loans.name: Luema

texts.en:
Luema is 30 years old and married, with four children. With her four children in school, Luema works very hard to provide for them.

Luema runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 8,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to purchase additional items, like toothpaste, sanitary napkins, sugar, coffee, vinegar, and other groceries to sell.

Luema has been in this business for 12 years and she sells a variety of items, such as toothpaste, sanitary napkins, sugar, coffee, vinegar, and other groceries. 

In the future, she would like to save enough money, so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional items, like toothpaste, sanitary napkins, sugar, coffee, vinegar, and other groceries to sell.

loans.name: Mehry

texts.ru:
Мехри, женщина в возрасте 51 года, живет в сельской местности Дж. Расуловского района. Она замужем имеет троих детей. Её дети уже взрослые.Мехри дружно живет со своей семей.  Она чистосердечная, добрая и старательная  женщина, еще с детство она занимается откармливанием и размножением крупно-рогатого скота. Она имеет дойную корову, которая каждый день дает по 10 л. молоко и она продает соседям и знакомым.  Также у нее  имеется телята которых она откармливает и продает  мясникам. Ее муж Жаббор работает плотником в частных стройках.
Мехри   говорит, что доход от этой вид деятельности стабильный, но низкий, поэтому она хочет увеличить количество коров, чтобы увеличит доходность этого бизнеса. Она очень надеется, что  "Арванд"  поддержит ее финансово.
texts.en:
Mehry is a woman of the age of 51 years. She lives in a village in the J. Rasulov region. She is married and has three children. Her children are already adults. Mehry lives happily with his family. She is a wholehearted, good and industrious woman. 

Since childhood, Mehry has worked with fattening and breeding cattle. She has a dairy cow, which gives around 10 liters of milk every day, and she sells this to neighbors and friends. She also has calves which she fattens and sells to the butcher. Her husband, Zhabbor, works as a carpenter in a private building company. Mehry tells us that the income from that type of activity is stable, but small. Therefore, she would like to increase the number of cows so that she can increase the income from this business. She hopes very much that Arvand will support her financially.

loans.use: to purchase cattle

loans.name: Mullohoja

texts.ru:
Муллоходжа мужчина  в возрасте 43 лет, женат имеет 3 детей. Муллоходжа занимается перевозкой грузов. Его рейс начинается рано утром на рынке стройматериалов. Жена сидит дома воспитывает детей. Раньше он занимался розничной торговлей дров и угля . Вскоре он приобрел старую машину и начал предоставлять транспортные услуги. 
Он хорошо известен среди своих клиентов как надежный и опытный водитель. 
Муллоходжа запрашивает кредит, чтобы приобрести небольшой "Портер" грузовик, который потребляет меньше топлива, чем другие грузовики, чтобы начать предоставлять качественно- транспортные услуги.  Его машина уже устарела и он хочет, на приобретенный кредит купить автомашину.
texts.en:
Mullohoja is a man of the age of 43. He is married and has three children. Mullohoja works with transporting cargo. His trip starts early in the morning at the market for building materials. His wife stays at home to raise the children. 

Earlier, Mullohoja worked with retail sales of firewood and coal. Soon he purchased an old vehicle and started providing a transportation service. He is well-known among his customers as a reliable and experienced driver. 

Mullohoja requests a loan to purchase a small "Porter" truck, which needs less fuel than the other trucks, in order to start providing a high quality transportation service. His vehicle is already old and he would like to buy a vehicle for the loan.

loans.use: to purchase a truck

loans.name: Mushpig

texts.en:
Mushpig, 41, is a married man who lives in Jandara, in the Gardabani district of Georgia. He has a wife, a son and his mother, who gets monthly assistance from the local government. His wife is a housekeeper. 

To take care of his family's everyday needs, Mushpig is engaged in buying and selling vehicles. He goes to Foti, in West Georgia, purchases cars at low prices and sells them in East Georgia at a good price. From this activity, he generates approximately 500 Georgia lari (GEL) per month. 

As it becomes harder to make a living from this income only, Mushpig has decided to start an agribusiness. This start-up program, which is a joint initiative between Kiva and Credo, enables the rural poor and inexperienced people to get loans for starting or re-starting businesses. His application was approved under the framework of this program for 4,000 GEL to purchase milk cows.  

After the cows are purchased, the family will start producing dairy products -- cheese and yogurt -- to sell. They will also use the milk products to feed the family. 

This new business initiative will give Mushpig a chance to have financial stability and grow his monthly income.

loans.use: to buy milk cows and start an agribusiness

loans.name: Fiqirete

texts.en: Fiqirete is back wanting your financial help again, yet this time to make home repairs. Kindly note that she is very grateful to all lenders and wishes them Happy Holidays:)

loans.use: to make minor repairs to the family home to accomodate her sick child

loans.name: Nino

texts.en:
Nino is 31 years old and is from Batumi city.  She is married and has one infant child. It is nearly a month since Nino and her husband has been running a  bakery together. Nino bakes various pies and makes sandwiches and her husband works as a salesperson. The business is going well but it needs support for developing.
 
In order to generate more income and expand her business, Nino is requesting a small-sized loan. With the received amount, she will buy raw materials and bake more pies. She will offer a wider assortment of products to her customers and increase turnover.

Nino and her family hopes for your kindness.

loans.use: invest in her bakery

loans.name: Tarieli

texts.en:
Tarieli is a 44-year-old married man who lives in Samtredia, West Georgia. He lives with wife and a little son. Tarieli's wife is a cleaner in a restaurant and gets 200 GEL monthly. Tarieli works as a driver for road construction.  He has several private orders during the month.  Approximately his income consists 300 GEL per month. However, this income is hardly enough for the family, considering the fact that Tarieli can generate more if he has a vehicle and works  as taxi driver everyday, in parallel to his present activities. 

Tarieli has now been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and Credo, that helps rural people to start or restart businesses. This loan is very important for Tarieli to be able to start providing taxi service and gain more income for his family. He awaits your support.

loans.use: buy a car to start a taxi business

loans.name: Suriya

texts.en:
Suriya is a 51-year-old, married woman, doing business selling milk for the past 20 years. She has two buffaloes in milk. She sells milk to many of her neighbors, along with butter that she makes from the milk. Her business is good enough to help her lead a decent life.
 
Suriya has three children. She is very motivated to provide them with a beautiful life, with good education, food, and clothing. She has improved her business to meet the day-to-day expenses of life. 
 
It’s Suriya's fourth year with Kashf Foundation. She is happily running her business, through the support of it. Now, Suriya requests a loan of PKR 40,000 to purchase one more buffalo. She hopes to get an increase in the production capacity of milk which, ultimately, helps in generating more cash.

loans.use: to purchase one more buffalo.

loans.name: Shamshad

texts.en:
Shamshad, age 41 and married, earns an income by operating a small general store in her community. She offers a variety of grocery items at a reasonable price and has retained many customers who regularly shop at her store. She earns enough from her business to provide for her family. 

In order to keep her store fully stocked, she has requested a loan in the amount of Rs 50,000, which she will use to buy stocks of rice, sugar, and flour from the market at lower rates. This will allow her to meet increasing demand consistently. 

She wishes to utilize part of her expected boost in revenue to increase her business capital.

loans.use: to buy stocks of rice, sugar, and flour.

loans.name: Juan Rafael

texts.es: Juan Rafael  nació en la comunidad de Jiguina  en esta comunidad ha vivido  toda su vida hasta la edad de 30 años vivió con sus padres y trabajo con ellos en los labores del campo, después conoció a la que hoy es su esposa y madre de sus 4 hijos al casarse sus padres le heredan unas manzanas de tierra ahí construyo su humilde hogar ademas de dedicarse a cultivar café y banano para tener ingresos para la subsistencia de su familia, su hijo mayor trabaja con el y los otros menores  estudian y van a la escuela. En la comunidad no hay energía eléctrica ellos se iluminan por las noches y en la madrugada que su esposa se levanta a preparar comida para que ellos lleven al trabajo con candelas o phoco con baterías , es por eso que el ahora que mira la posibilidad de tener un sistema solar atravez de crédito se siente feliz ya que podrá por fin  tener luz en su hogar
texts.en:
Juan Rafael was born in the community of Jiguina and he lived there the first 30 years of his life with his parents, working alongside them in the fields. Then he met the woman who is now his wife and mother to his four children. When they got married he inherited a few manzanas (1 manzana equals 1.72 acre) of land from his parents on which he built their modest home. He grows coffee and bananas in order to have the resources to support his family. His oldest son works with him and the younger ones study and go to school.

The community has no electrical energy to light their homes at night. So in the early morning his wife gets up to prepare food for them. She works by candlelight or a light powered by a battery. So now they are looking at the possibility of having a solar system through this loan. They feel happy that they can finally have light in their home.

loans.use: to buy a solar system.

loans.name: Alejandro

texts.es: Don Alejandro, padre de familia de tres hijos de las edades de 21, 13 y 11 años, todos estudiantes y aspirantes a una carrera profesional y para don Alejandro es su principal prioridad, el se dedica junto a su esposa con el pequeño negocio de destace de cerdos los cuales vende por libra y enteros, mientras su esposa hace y vende tortillas. Con este crédito que solicita, comprara dos cerdos de 240 libras cada uno  para destace y comercializarlo, ya que tiene encargos que le han hecho con anterioridad, esto viene a mejorar sus ingresos que le permite mantener a su familia.
texts.en: Alejandro is the father of three children, ages 21, 13, and 11.  They are all students, aspiring to a professional career, and this is Alejandro’s main priority.  He and his wife are engaged in a small business butchering pigs, which they sell whole and by the pound.  In addition, his wife prepares and sells tortillas.   With the loan he is requesting, he will purchase two pigs at 240 pounds each to butcher and sell.  Since he has order that were previously placed, this will improve his income and allow him to support his family.

loans.use: to purchase two pigs at 240 pounds each.

loans.name: Perpetua

texts.en:
Perpetua is a married woman with a sari-sari store business, from Loon, Bohol. She has two children and her family inspires her to work hard to earn a living.  In her store, she sells various items, like cooking oil, rice, coffee, sugar, detergent, toiletries, Avon products, noodles, and sanitary pads. 

Perpetua is asking for a loan to buy more merchandise, like detergent, canned foods, sugar, shampoo, bath soap, and snack food. This will help, so she can increase her inventory. Through this loan, she can attract more customers, if her store looks full and attractive. 

In the future, Perpetua dreams of expanding her store, so that it will generate more income and will improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy detergent, canned foods, sugar, shampoo, bath soap, and snack food.

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen is a rice farmer from the town of Antequera, Bohol. She is a married woman and the mother of two school-aged children. She started farming eight years ago. She is requesting a loan to buy seedlings, fertilizer and to pay for labor. Helen knows that the success of farming is also attributed to fertilizer and the loan will be a great help to make her farming a success.

Her income provides food and pays school fees for her children. In the future, Helen hopes to have another business to maximize her income.

loans.use: to buy seedlings, fertilizer and to pay for labor.

loans.name: Salome

texts.en:
For 11 years now, Salome has been engaging in hog raising business. She enjoys doing this livelihood because it allows her to stay at home and look after her school-aged children. Salome is asking for a loan to buy more piglets and feed to keep the hogs healthy. With availability of feed, she can focus on looking after her animals without having to worry about the finances for hogs.

She can be assured of a better return of investment in four months time. Her income provides school fees, food, and home renovations for her family.

loans.use: to buy piglets and feed.

loans.name: Ogechi

texts.fr: Mariée à un revendeur et mère de 02 enfants de 08 et 05ans scolarisés,madame Ogechi quant à elle s'est aussi lancée dans l'activité de vente d'habits. Elle exerce son activité au marché et achète au même lieu. N’arrivant pas à satisfaire les clients à cause du manque de marchandises, elle sollicite un premier crédit pour acheter des marchandises. Le profit l'aidera à agrandir son activité et assurer les moindres besoins de la famille.
texts.en: Married to a retailer, Ms. Ogechi is a mother of two children, aged 8 and 5 years old. As for herself, she also got started in the business of selling clothing. She operates at the market and makes her purchases at the same location. Not able to satisfy her customers due to a lack of merchandise, she is requesting an initial loan to purchase some. The profit will help her to expand her business and ensure the basic needs of her family are met.

loans.use: to purchase secondhand clothing

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en:
Lorna, age 55, operates a handicraft business to earn an income. She is pictured here with some of the products she makes and sells. She has been engaged in her business for the past 10 years and works hard to support her family. She and her husband have one child who is still attending school.

Lorna has requested a loan in the amount of PhP 10,000 through NWTF. She will use her loan funds to buy materials like nylon thread, shells, and wire for her business.

Her goal is to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy materials like nylon thread, shells, and wire for her handicraft business

loans.name: Luzvinia

texts.en:
Luzvinia works hard to support her family. Luzvinia is married, and she has an egg vending business in the Philippines.

Luzvinia has requested a PHP 8,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional trays of eggs to sell.

Luzvinia has been in this business for five years now.

In the future, Luzvinia would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more trays of eggs to sell

loans.name: Ma. Imelda

texts.en:
Ma. Emelda is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a food vending business in the Philippines. She is borrowing 15,000 PHP through NWTF to buy ingredients like hotdogs, chicken, chicken liver, pork, etc. for her food vending business. Ma. Emelda has been in this business for 6 years and she earns additional income from a general store.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her food vending business. Ma. Emelda has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts and with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like hotdogs, chicken, chicken liver, pork, etc. for her food vending business.

loans.name: Ma. Teresita

texts.en:
Ma. Teresita is 41 years old and married with six children. With four children currently in school, she works very hard to provide for them.

Ma. Teresita runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 7,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy additional stocks to sell in her general store. She has been in this business for eight years and sells a variety of items such as canned goods, cooking oil, sugar, soft drinks, candies, seasonings, cereals, etc. 

Ma. Teresita would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Magdalena

texts.en:
Magdalina is 57 years old and married, with eight children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. 

Magdalina has a food vending business in the Philippines.  She has requested a PHP 15,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food business.

She successfully paid back her previous loan, and she is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Magdalina has been in this business for 25 years.  She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Maricel

texts.en:
Maricel is married, with two children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Maricel is 26 years old, and both children are in school.

Maricel has a rug-making business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 9,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy additional materials, like fabric, for her business.

Maricel has been in this business for five years.  She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more materials, like fabric, for her rug-making

loans.name: Carlos Humberto

texts.es:
Carlos, es soltero, no tiene hijos, tampoco recibe otro tipo de ayuda económica para pagar sus gastos personales se dedica a vender ropa en un horario de 6:00 a.m. a 4:00 p.m., no representa ninguna dificultad administrar.
Invertirá en la compra de ropa, con estilos nuevos, colores y tallas diferentes, para niños y ambos sexos, con lo que su negocio estará fortalecido para estas fechas navideñas, espera aprovechar la temporada e incrementar  sus ventas para obtener mejores ingresos, con los que podrá cancelar su deuda adquirida.
Anhela tener un negocio más amplio y mejorar su situación economica.
texts.en:
Carlos is single, and he does not have children.  He does not receive any type of financial help to pay for his personal expenses.  He sells clothes, and his schedule is from 6:00 a.m. until 4:00 p.m.  He has no difficulty running the business.

He will use the loan to buy new styles, colors, and different sizes of clothes for children.  With this, his business will be strengthened for the Christmas holidays.  He hopes to takes advantage of the season and to increase his sales in order to improve his income.  With the increased sales he will be able to repay his debt.

He is eager to have a bigger business and to improve his financial situation.

loans.use: to buy clothes.

loans.name: Maritza Elizabeth

texts.es:
Maritza, se ve en la necesidad de invertir más en el negocio, por lo que solicita otro crédito para facilitar la compra de arroz, aceite, frijol, maíz, verduras, bebidas y algunas mesas, con lo que podrá seguir preparando el menú de su negocio y mejorara la imagen del mismo.
Con el crédito anterior conto con la facilidad de comprar vitaminas, cremas para la piel, etc., hoy cuenta con un aventa de comida para tner más ingresos extraas para incrementar sus ventas, aumentar sus ingresos, satisfacer a sus clientes, cancelar sus deudas y mejorar el estilo de vida familiar.
texts.en:
Maritza sees the need to invest more in her business.  For this reason she is requesting another loan to facilitate the purchase of rice, oil, beans, corn, vegetables, drinks and some tables so that she will be able to continue preparing the food in her business and also improve its image.

The previous loan made it possible for her to purchase vitamins, skin creams, etc.  Today she also counts on food sales in order to have extra income to increase her sales, increase her revenue, satisfy her customers, pay her debts and improve her family’s lifestyle.

loans.use: to purchase rice, oil, beans, corn, vegetables, drinks and some tables.

loans.name: Erica Andrea

texts.es:
Erica, a sus 25 años de edad, es madre soltera de un hijo de 5 años, por quien lucha incansablemente para brindarle el sustento diario. Los ingresos que genera son producto de su labor como comerciante independiente, ya que vende mercancía como ropa y calzado; el oficio lo aprendió de un familiar que le explicó todo lo relacionado con el manejo del negocio; esto le ha permitido sacar adelante a su hijo y aportar a la economía del hogar en el que vive con sus padres. Adicionalmente y de manera alterna, trabaja en una fábrica de arepas por días; así genera un ingreso adicional para solventar todos los gastos de su hijo. 
Actualmente solicita el crédito con el propósito de invertirlo en la compra de mercancía al por mayor (blusas, jeans, calzado, sandalias, entre otros), esto le permitirá abastecerse con más variedad para satisfacer los diversos gustos y necesidades de sus clientes y, mejorar las ventas en esta temporada navideña; logrando mejorar los ingresos.
Erica, con el ánimo de superarse y estar en la capacidad de brindar a su hijo una mejor calidad de vida, sueña con realizar una carrera universitaria y convertirse en una profesional íntegra y exitosa y montar su propia microempresa para generar una estabilidad económica favorable que le permita dar a su hijo una excelente educación y un mejor bienestar.
texts.en:
Erica, 25, has a 5-year old son.  She is a single mother and works day and night to support herself and her boy.  She operates a business selling clothing and footwear, work that she learned from a relative who has a similar business.  She and her son live with her parents and her income from the business helps support the family.  Erica also has a part-time job at a local factory that provides extra income.
Erica is applying for a loan that she will use to buy wholesale supplies of clothing (blouses, jeans, shoes, sandals, etc.) that she will then resell.  The investment will allow her to expand her inventory and meet the extra demand that is normal for this time of year.  
Erica very much wants to make a better life for herself and her son.  She would like to go on to college and a successful business career.  Setting up a small business of her own would give her the financial stability she needs to provide her son with a good education and a good start in life.

loans.use: to stock her clothing sales business.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is 49 years old and from the village of Tamarisi. She is divorced and lives alone in her old house. 

Mary rents a room in her house to earn a living. Her earning is hardly enough to cover feeding expenses. 

In order to generate more income, Mary is requesting a loan. She will buy a stock of merchandise at wholesale prices to start a clothing sales business among community members.

Mary will offer her clients a wide assortment of winter clothing, linens, and various household items and give them the option of paying later for their purchases. 

The loan will enable Mary to earn a profit and save more money to satisfy her everyday needs. She awaits your generosity

loans.use: to buy stocks of clothing and household items for resale

loans.name: Hilaria

texts.es: Doña Hilaria, tiene 59 años de edad, esta separada de su esposo, tiene 4 hijos y vive en el municipio de Puerto, Cortes. Se dedica, a la venta de comida, almuerzos por encargo, golosinas y pastelitos rellenos de jamón y queso. El negocio lo tiene hace 22 años en su casa. El préstamo es por 30,000 lempiras y es el octavo ciclo con la institución para mantener su negocio activo. El cual lo invertirá en la compra de materia prima como arroz, frijoles, verduras, condimentos, lácteos, manteca, carnes etc. para elaborar las comidas que tiene de encargo. Su meta es que de las ganancias va mejorar su casa y el local de su negocio.
texts.en: Hilaria is 59 years old and is separated.  She has four children and lives in the town of Puerto, Cortes.  She sells food, lunch to order, shacks and ham and cheese filled cakes.  She has had this business for 22 years and runs it out of her home.  This loan will be for 30,000 Lempiras and is the eighth in her cycle with the institution so she can keep her business active.  She will use the money to buy rice, beans, vegetables, condiments, milk, lard, meats, etc. to make the foods that have been ordered.  Her goal is to improve her home and place of business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients.

loans.name: Kenia Maria

texts.es:
Kenia es una joven de 23 años de edad con un grado de estudio secundario completo, casado siendo su pareja agricultor igual que ella y actualmente no tienen hijos. Desde hace 2 años ella trabaja el cultivo de papaya y también el cultivo de hortalizas, la cría de cerdos el cual está ubicado en un pedazo de tierra que ella y su esposo compraron gracias a la buena administración y la visión de dar a sus futuros hijos una mejor calidad de vida. Ella y su esposo viven en casa de sus padres pero ellos no se involucran en el trabajo de campo. Sus clientes son las diferentes personas de la comunidad, mercados locales, intermediarios entre otros que son consumidores de un producto con calidad e higiénico. La tierra que ella y su esposo trabajan es propia y está ubicada en otra comunidad a la cual viajan en el autobús de ruta.
Kenia ha solicitado financiamiento para la compra de insumos agrícolas como fertilizantes, abono, fungicidas que ayudaran al desarrollo, crecimiento y cuidado de sus cultivos de papaya como también la compra de y semilla certificada para cultivar.
Sus metas mejorar su calidad de vida, la ampliación de sus cultivos de papaya mediante la compra de más tierra para no solo depender de un solo producto si no también ofrecer una diversidad que permita generar mayores ingresos.
texts.en:
Kenia is a 23 year old young woman with a middle school education.  She is married and her husband is a farmer, like her.  The don’t have any children.  She has been raising papaya and vegetables for two years and also raises pigs on a plot of land that she and her husband bought thanks to her good management and vision of providing a better quality of life for her children.  She and her husband live with her parents but they don’t work in the fields.  Her customers are the different people in the community, local markets, intermediaries, and others who consume her quality and hygienic product.  They own their land and it’s located in another community and travel there by bus.

Kenia is asking for a loan to buy farming supplies such as fertilizers, compost, and fungicides, that will help with the development of her papaya crops.  She will also buy certified seeds.

Her goals are to improve her quality of life and expand her papaya crop by buying more land so that she will not have to depend on a single product, but also have some diversity so she can earn a greater income.

loans.use: to buy farming supplies.

loans.name: Erik Yessenia

texts.es: Erik, tiene 30 años de edad, es casada, tiene dos hijos y reside en el municipio de Arizona, Atlántida. anteriormente de dedicaba  a la venta de ropa y productos plásticos. Con el fin de buscar mas ingresos decidió hace un año comprar y vender cerdos y también destazar y vender la carne. Ella ha solicitado varios prestamos para mantener sus actividades de negocio. Actualmente ha solicitado otro préstamo que es por 15,000 Lempiras, con el cual va comprar cerdos para engorde y compra de ropa para vender en esta temporada. Su plan es obtener mas ingresos para bienestar familiar.
texts.en:
Erik is 30 years old.  She is married and she has two children.  She lives in the town of Arizona, Atlántida.  Previously she worked selling clothing and plastic products.  Seeking greater income she decided a year ago to purchase and sell pigs and also to butcher and sell the meat.  She has requested several loans to maintain her business activities. 

Currently she has requested another loan that is for 15,000 Lempiras (HNL), with which she is going to purchase pigs to fatten and purchase clothing to sell this season.  Her plan is to obtain more income for the wellbeing of her family.

loans.use: to purchase pigs to fatten and to purchase clothing to sell.

loans.name: Sandra Patricia

texts.es:
Doña Sandra es ama de casa y agricultora, con una edad de 38 años, casada y madre de 2 hijos quienes están en secundaria y al salir de sus  actividades estudiantiles ayudan a sus padres en las diferentes actividades de campo. El tipo de negocio que en familia desarrollan es la caficultura como también el servicio de moto taxi en toda la zona por más de 1 año. En la caficultura fueron sus padres quienes le enseñaron a trabajar la tierra a muy temprana edad ya que el rubro del café es el único medio de ingreso en su familia y hasta hace poco el servicio de transporte. Los planes para el futuro es poder contar con una unidad más de servicio de trasporte para poder generar mayores ingresos. Sus clientes para el producto de café son los diferentes compradores (intermediarios) que llegan a la zona en busca de un buen producto con calidad, aún muy buen precio y con un buen sabor. Sus sueños poder ampliar más sus cultivos de café, comprar más tierra y sembrar una mejor y mayor variedad para poder cubrir la demanda insatisfecha. 
Por lo que hoy en día ella ha solicitado financiamiento para la compra de fertilizantes, abono, foliares, pago de personas para la recolección del grano ya que gracias a este financiamiento ella podrá solventar los gastos que se le avecinan en la temporada de cosecha.
texts.en:
Sandra is a housewife and a farmer. She is 36 years old, married and mother of two children. They study in High School and after their school activities they help their parents with the different tasks in the fields.

The family runs a coffee plantation and have also have had a motorcycle taxi providing service to their area for the past year. She was taught about coffee growing by her parents at a very young age and coffee has been the only source of income for the family until recently with the addition of the taxi.

Their plan for the intermediate future is to purchase another motorcycle taxi in order to generate more income. The buyers of the coffee are the middlemen who arrive in the area looking for quality coffee but at a good price and with good flavor. Their dreams are to expand their plantings and plant a greater variety of plants to cover the unfilled demand.

So they have requested financing to buy fertilizer, manure, foliar spray, and pay for labor to harvest the coffee. Thanks to this loan they can pay the expenses that come with the harvest season.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies and to pay for labor to harvest her coffee crops.

loans.name: Fiqirete

texts.en:
Fiqireta is a 58-year-old widowed mother of a 22-year-old son who was born with a disability. They live in a little town of approximately 10,000 inhabitants where Fiqireta and her son have been running a bar-restaurant for this past year. 

Fiqireta is applying for a loan for the first time to stock up on inventory items, and she is asking for your financial help. 

Here it is what she said during the interview with the loan officer: “I want to succeed at it. The earnings from the restaurant are the only income for me and my son. This is the only way me and my son will survive financially. I hope that lenders will show some understanding to our situation and our drive to succeed and lend to us. We would be very appreciative to their kindness.”

loans.use: to stock up on inventory items for her bar-restaurant

loans.name: Safar

texts.ru: Сафар является торговцем. Ему 47 лет. Он занимается куплей и продажей фисташек в своем районе Гиссар. Сафар женат, имеет пятерых детей. Его дети учатся в школе. Жена Сафара помогает ему в торговле. Прибыль с бизнеса является единственным источником дохода семьи. Сафар занимается торговлей фисташек на протяжении 11 лет. В данный момент он нуждается в кредите. Сафар просит кредит, чтобы купить партию фисташек для перепродажи. Благодаря кредиту он сможет продолжить свой торговый бизнес. Он надеется на поддержку.
texts.en: Safar is 47 and a merchant. He has been buying and selling pistachios in his region of Gissar for 11 years. Safar is married and has five children who are in school. His wife helps him with the business, the revenue from which is their family's only source of income. Safar is currently in need of a loan to purchase a shipment of pistachios for resale, so that he can continue his business. He hopes for your support.

loans.use: to buy pistachios for resale

loans.name: Gerarda

texts.en:
Gerarda is a 53-year-old married woman and mother of two children, ages 22 and 12. For several years, Gerarda has been engaging in a food-vending business. She cooks rice cakes and pancakes, which she sells in her community. Gerarda is requesting a loan of 6,000 PHP to buy milk, sugar, and flour. 

Whatever income she will generate from this business, will be used to pay for school fees and family consumption.

loans.use: to buy milk, sugar, and flour to make and sell rice cakes and pancakes.

loans.name: Lito

texts.en:
Lito is a 31-year-old man living in Panglao, Bohol. He is married with three young children. 

Lito is involved in a fishing business to support his family. He works hard in order to meet the basic needs such as food and school fees for his children.

He is asking for a loan in order to buy fish net and pay for boat maintenance and repair.

He hopes that his fishing business will continue to thrive so that he can support his family and eventually uplift their present living conditions.

loans.use: to buy fish net and pay for boat maintenance and repair

loans.name: Madelyn

texts.en:
Madelyn is a 30-year-old married woman with three children who are still in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur, and has a general store business in the Philippines. Madelyn requested a 5,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase more goods to sell in her general store.

Madelyn has been in this business for three years. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more goods to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Margarette

texts.en:
Margarette works hard to support her family. Margarette is married and has a food vending business in the Philippines.

Margarette requested a PHP 7,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more ingredients, such as meat, spices, vegetables, etc. for her business.

Margarette has been in this business for one year now.

Margarette would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more ingredients, such as meat, spices, vegetables, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Margie

texts.en:
Margie is a married woman with four children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Margie is 38 years old and two of her children are still in school.

Margie has a selling soft-drinks and beers business in the Philippines. Margie requested a PHP 5,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase additional cases of soft-drinks and beers to resell.

Margie has been in this business for three years. In the future, Margie would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase additional cases of soft-drinks and beers to resell.

loans.name: Ma. Fe

texts.en:
Ma. Fe is a married woman with five children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Ma. Fe is 50 years old and one of her children is still in school.

Ma. Fe has a general store business in the Philippines. Ma. Fe requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more items to resell in her general store.

Ma. Fe has been in this business for three years. Ma. Fe would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more items to resell in her general store.

loans.name: Maricar

texts.en:
Maricar works hard to support her family. Maricar is married and has a handicraft business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for eight years now.

Maricar has requested a loan of 15,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase more raw materials for her business.

In the future, Maricar would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more raw materials for her business

loans.name: Julieta

texts.en:
Julieta owns a sari-sari (variety store) business, selling various items to the people in her place. Julieta is asking for a loan to buy more stocks to resell, such as beverages, soaps, shampoos, canned goods, soda, toiletries, rice, bread and snack foods. With this, she will be able to improve the diversity of her stocks, thus attract more buyers and customers. 

In the future, Julieta hopes to expand her store so that it will generate more revenue, necessary for the needs of her family, like food and paying the electricity and water bills.

loans.use: to buy beverages, soaps, shampoos, canned goods, soda, toiletries, rice, bread and snack foods to resell.

loans.name: Oscar Armando

texts.es:
Oscar, es una persona soltera no tiene hijos, para cubrir sus gastos tiene una tienda en la que ofrece a sus clientes productos de primera necesidad, atiende de 8:00 a.m. a 5:00 p.m., según estén las ventas.
El préstamo le permitirá renovar su inventario comprando golosinas, bebidas, granos básicos, aceite, entre otros productos que sus clientes necesitan para consumo de sus hogares, espera atraer nuevos clientes, aumentar sus ventas, mejorar sus ganancias con las que cumplirá con sus compromisos económicos.
Anhela ampliar su negocio y mejorar su economía.
texts.en: Oscar is single and doesn’t have children.  To pay his expenses, he has a store in which he sells basic necessities.  He serves his customers from 8:00 a.m. to 5:00 p.m., depending on sales.  This loan will allow him to restock his inventory and purchase candy, beverages, basic grains, oil, and other products that his customers need for home consumption. He hopes to attract new customers, increase his sales, and improve his profits, which he will use to meet his financial commitments.  He wishes to expand his business and improve his finances.

loans.use: to purchase candy, beverages, basic grains, oil, and other products.

loans.name: Dolores Mirna

texts.es:
Dolores, disfruta de la compañía de sus dos hijos de 8 y 12 años, es madre soltera, no recibe ayuda para sacar a sus hijos adelante, por su iniciativa propia instalo una tienda en su casa de habitación, la atiende de 7:00 a.m. hasta las 8:00 p.m., su facilidad es que de esta manera puede estar pendiente de su familia y su negocio.
Necesita comprar golosinas, bebidas y productos de la canasta básica, lo que le permite ofrecer a sus clientes mejores opciones de compra, espera seguir atendiendo bien a sus clientes, tener mejores ventas e incrementar las ganancias que necesita para salir cancelar las deudas y cubrir sus gastos familiares. 
Sueña con tener un negocio más amplio que le dé la rentabilidad que necesita para salir adelante junto a su familia.
texts.en:
Dolores enjoys the company of her two children, aged 8 and 12. She is a single mother who receives no help in raising her children. On her own initiative she opened a store in her house. She works from 7 am until 8 pm. It is easy for her to take care of both her family and the store.

Dolores needs to buy sweets, drinks, and basic food items which will provide her customers with a better selection of products to buy. She hopes to continue to give good service to her customers and increase her sales which she needs to pay off her debts and cover the family expenses. She dreams of having a bigger business that provides the income necessary to get ahead with her family.

loans.use: to buy sweets, drinks and basic food products.

loans.name: Patricia Esmeralda

texts.es:
Patricia, solicita un nuevo préstamo para invertir en la tienda con lo que comprara golosinas, bebidas, detergentes, azúcar, jabón, etc., con lo que su negocio estará preparado para las fiestas navideñas, que es el momento preciso en que aumentan las ventas.
Con el capital que se le facilito anteriormente surtió el negocio, aumentaron sus clientes, sus ventas son mejores y sus condiciones económicas son mejores. Su familia se mantiene con el mismo núcleo familiar.
texts.en: Patricia is asking for a new loan to invest in the store. With it, she will buy snacks, beverages, detergents, sugar, soap, etc. With it, her business will be prepared for the Christmas holiday. That is the exact time when her sales increase. With the capital she received previously, she increased her customers, her sales are better, and her financial condition is better. She still has the same nuclear family.

loans.use: to buy snacks, beverages, detergent, sugar, soap, etc. .

loans.name: Maricon

texts.en:
Maricon has a live-in partner and one child. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Maricon is 38 years old and her child is still in school.

Maricon has a bicycle transport business in the Philippines. Maricon requested a PHP 5,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase an additional unit of bicycle for her business.

Maricon has been in this business for four years. In the future, Maricon would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase an additional unit of bicycle for her business.

loans.name: Sulma Patricia

texts.es:
Sulma, opta por otro crédito para surtir su negocio de venta de comida y pupusas, comprara carnes,aceite, arroz, frijol, repollo, bebidas, etc., lo que la da la oportunidad de continuar trabajando sin dificultades.
Con el capital que se le facilito antes Sulma fortaleció el negocio lo suficiente para cumplir con las demandas de sus clientes, tiene una mejor imagen de su servicio, sus ventas aumentaron y sus ganancias son mayores.
texts.en:
Sulma has chosen to take another loan to stock up her business selling food and pupusas (a traditional Salvadoran dish made of thick stuffed tortillas).  She will use the loan to buy meat, cooking oil, rice, beans, cabbage, drinks, etc.  This will enable her to continue to work without any difficulties.

With her previous loan, Sulma was able to strengthen her business enough to meet the demand of her customers.  Now her business has a better reputation, her sales have increased, and so have her earnings.

loans.use: to buy meat, cooking oil, rice, beans, cabbage, drinks, and other items

loans.name: Mirna Yishel

texts.es:
Mirna, está satisfecha con los resultados que tiene al utilizar los créditos para invertir en su negocio comprara ropa y materia prima para elaborar pan, de esta manera fortalecerá el inventario de negocio.
Con el préstamo anterior le ayudo a adquirir los materiales necesarios para fortalecer su negocio, tiene más clientes satisfechos, sus ventas han aumentado, su economía es más estable, sus condiciones familiares son mejores.
texts.en:
Mirna is satisfied with the results of her previous loan.  She will use this loan to invest in her business, buying clothing and ingredients to make bread.  In this way, she will stock up on inventory for her business.

With her previous loan, Mirna was able to acquire the materials she needed to strengthen her business.  She now has more satisfied customers, her sales have increase, her finances are now more stable, and her family's living conditions are better.

loans.use: to buy clothing and supplies to make bread

loans.name: Maricela Del Carmen

texts.es:
Maricela, opta por otro crédito para invertir en la compra de ropa para caballeros, damas y niños, tales como falas, pantalones, camisas, blusas, trajes, entre otros, le ayudaran a satisfacer a sus clientes en esta temporada navideña.
Con el crédito anterior le ayudo a cubrir la demanda existente que tenia de sus clientes hoy en día cuenta con clientes nuevos, mejores ventas, su economía más estable lo que le permitió cancelar sus deudas, dar a su familia una mejora alimentación, salud y vestuario.
texts.en:
Maricela is choosing to take another loan to invest in the purchase of clothing for men, women and children, such as: skirts, pants, shirts, blouses, suits, and other items.  This will help her to satisfy her customers in the Christmas season.

With her previous loan, Maricela was able to meet the demand of her existing customers.  Today, she has some new customers, higher sales, and more stable finances which have enabled her to pay off her debts and give her family better food, health and clothing.

loans.use: to buy clothing for men, women and children

loans.name: Ashot

texts.en:
Ashot is from Vanadzor town where he lives with his wife and 17-year-old son.

Ashot is construction worker. Particularly, he provides construction and renovation services for locals in Vanadzor town and also for nearby villages. He perfectly manages to cover his family's daily costs of living. As the only breadwinner of the family, he works hard to gather good income and provide appropriate living conditions for his family. Ashot was able to save some money for purchasing a car, and in order to pay the missing part of money, Ashot has decided to take out a loan. He asks for this loan to be able to get the remaining part of money that he needs for purchasing a car. 

Ashot has now been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF International. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products. The loan will be a huge support for Ashot and he hopes for lenders' support.

loans.use: to pay for a car.

loans.name: Juan Jose

texts.es: Juan Jose es de descendencia humilde sus padres siempre se dedicaron a cuidar fincas cafetaleras así que el hasta la edad de 9 años anduvo con ellos de comunidad en comunidad. Después sus padres con esfuerzo logrado por tantos años de trabajo  compraron  un terreno  en la comunidad de el consuelo ya ahí decidieron quedarse y hacer vida el creció al lado de sus padres y trabajo junto con ellos , a la edad de 22 años tubo que alejarse de ellos pues tenia que hacer el servicio militar  dos años después gracias a Dios regreso con vida y  su padre le dio unas manzanas de tierra para que sembrara café y granos  básicos. Así poco a poco el se hizo de sus cosas cuando ya se caso ya tenia un hogar para darle a su esposa luego vinieron los hijos a los que ha sacado adelante con mucho esfuerzo pues el desea que ellos estudien y se preparen. En esta comunidad no ha llegado la energía convencional es por eso que  el hará tramite de crédito para comprar un pequeño sistema solar y así poder  tener luz en su vivienda, a su familia le emociona la idea de que tendrán luz por las noches y que podrán realizar otras actividades .
texts.en:
Juan Jose came from humble origins. His parents always worked on coffee farms. Thus, until the age of 9, he would walk with them from community to community. Later, his parents, after many years of labor, managed to buy land in the community of El Consuelo. Here, they decided to remain and make a life. Juan Jose grew up alongside his parents, working side by side with them. 

At the age of 22, he had to separate from them in order to perform military service. Two years later, thank God, Juan Jose returned alive and his father gave him some manzanas of land so that he could grow coffee and basic grains.

Now, little by little, Juan Jose took charge of his own affairs and by the time he married, he had a home to offer his wife. Then came the children and with great effort, Juan Jose advanced their lives, since he desired that they study and prepare themselves.

Conventional electrical energy has not come to this community. That's why Juan Jose is applying for a loan to purchase a small solar system and, thus, they can have lights in their home. His family is excited about the idea of having lights at night and being able to carry out other activities.

loans.use: to buy a solar system to provide electricity for his home.

loans.name: La Labor (Flat) Group

texts.es: El grupo “La Labor” está ubicado en una comunidad muy tranquila los habitantes aún se dedican al cultivo de maíz, son personas muy amables. El grupo está integrado por cuatro mujeres muy trabajadoras y responsables  platican que el nombre del grupo lo eligieron porque hace referencia al trabajo y empeño que tienen que realizar. Beatriz o Bety, quien es la representante del grupo, platica que tiene 31 años de edad está casada con René desde hace siete años y juntos han formado una familia con tres hijos los cuales aun se encuentran estudiando. Bety está solicitando un crédito para comprar pollos, tiene una pequeña pollería desde hace ya varios años, inicio su negocio porque anteriormente ella y su esposo trabajaban en una granja de pollos pero René sufrió un accidente y cambiaron de domicilio. Comenzaron a vender pollo en una mesita afuera de su casa, pero con el tiempo fueron ganándose clientes y decidieron iniciar la venta de sus pollos en un local más estable pero también porque en el tiempo de lluvias se dificulta obtener ganancias. “También quiero mi crédito para comprar juguetes porque ya se vienen las fiestas más grandes del pueblo son las épocas donde más se vende”. La dificultad para el negocio de Bety es que las personas de la comunidad no le compran la carne fresca ellas prefieren la carne de varios días antes porque se las dejan más barata y esta situación ocasiona que sus ventas bajen. Otro reto es cuando las autoridades de la comunidad invitan a verder a otros comerciantes a la comunidad pues también le afecta en sus ventas. Sin embargo, Bety y René son muy trabajadores y seguirán con su negocio para cumplir su meta que es lograr construir granjas y criar pollos para ser proveedores en un futuro. Las integrantes del grupo son: Lety, quien invertirá en una tienda de abarrotes; Yolanda y Margarita, en borregos.
texts.en:
The “La Labor” group is located in a tranquil community where the residents still raise corn and are friendly.  The group is made up of four hardworking and responsible women who say that they chose their name because it makes reference to the work and effort that they have to do.

Beatriz, or Bety, who represents the group, says that she is 31 years old, married to Rene for seven years, and together have a family with three children who still attend school. Betty is asking for a loan to buy chickens. She has had a small chicken house for several years and she started her business because she and her husband previously worked on a chicken farm, but Rene had an accident and they moved.

They started selling chicken from a stand outside their home, and in time began gaining customers and decided to start selling from a more stable location, but also because to was difficult to make any money during the rainy season.  “I also want the loan to buy toys because the biggest festivals in town are coming and this is when they sell most.”

The difficulty that Bety faces in her business is that people in the community don’t buy fresh meat.  They prefer that which is a few days old because they sell it for less money and this causes her sales to drop.  Another challenge is when the community authorities invite other merchants to the town and this also affects her sales.

However, Bety and Rene are hard workers and they will continue their business so they can reach their goal of building farms and raising chickens so they can become suppliers in the future.  The members of the group are Lety, who will invest into her grocery store, and Yolanda and Margarita who will invest in sheep.

loans.use: to buy chickens and toys.

location.town: San Felipe del Progreso, Estado de México

loans.name: Roel

texts.en:
Roel owns and operates a tricycle business in Cortes, Bohol. He is married and has two children, ages 10 and 13. From the income he generates, he supports his family needs for food and pay school fees for his children. Roel is asking for a loan so he can better take care of his transportation business.

It will be used to buy spare parts and pay for vulcanization and engine maintenance. Once these are met, he will be assured of continued transportation service in his community, giving him a better chance of an income. His profit will be for tuition fees and healthy meals for his family.

loans.use: to buy spare parts and pay for vulcanization and engine maintenance.

loans.name: Ma. Luisa

texts.en: Ma. Luisa is 39 years old and hails from Panglao, Bohol. She is married and has two dependent children. Ma. Luisa and her husband have been engaged in fishing business for more than 10 years now. This is their main livelihood that sustains her family. She is asking for a loan to buy new fishing nets, fishing weights, and nylon for fishing net repair. These will be helpful so their fishing activity will be more productive and successful. The income they will generate from fishing will be used to buy healthy diet for the whole family and pay for school fees.

loans.use: to buy nylon for fishing net repair, new fishing nets, and fishing weights.

loans.name: Eutropia

texts.en:
Eutropia is from Antequera, Bohol. She owns and operates a sari-sari store business in her place and sells items like canned goods, noodles, candies, cookies, toiletries and seasonings. She is asking for a loan to buy more stocks of biscuits, canned goods, detergent, seasoning, shampoo and soda. The loan will be a great help in order for her to increase her profits and to keep customers loyal once all the goods are available. 

In the future, she will continue to invest in her business and make it more profitable.

loans.use: to buy biscuits, canned goods, detergent, seasoning, shampoo and soda.

loans.name: Dominiciana

texts.en:
Dominiciana owns a sari-sari or variety store business selling cornstarch, sugar, canned goods, soy sauce, vinegar and candies to the people in her place. She has been in business for more than four years now. 

Dominiciana is asking for a loan to buy additional stock to sell like canned goods, noodles, soda and beverages, soap and detergents, cooking ingredients and seasoning. With a loan, she will be more motivated to find ways to make her customers loyal to her business, thus, increasing her income. 

In the future, she hopes to have a bigger store to increase business profitability.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, noodles, soda and beverages, soap and detergents, cooking ingredients and seasoning.

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Lydia, age 59, runs a general store to earn an income. She has been engaged in her business for one year and sells a variety of items such as canned goods, snack foods, noodles, soft drinks, milk, and juice. She and her partner have six children and she works very hard to provide for them.

Lydia has requested a PhP 6,000 loan through NWTF. She will use her loan funds to replenish her stock of canned goods, snack foods, noodles, soft drinks, milk, and juice.
 
Her goal is to build and expand her business in order to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snack foods, noodles, soft drinks, milk, and juice to offer for sale

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en:
Marilou is 33 years old and has a live-in partner with three children. Marilou works very hard to provide for them.

Marilou runs a general store in the Philippines, and requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items, such as colognes, snack foods, sugar, milk, juice, coffee, noodles and other groceries to resell.

Marilou has been in this business for two years, and sells a variety of items, such as colognes, snack foods, sugar, milk, juice, coffee, noodles and other groceries. 

Marilou would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional items, such as colognes, snack foods, sugar, milk, juices, coffee, noodles, and other groceries to resell.

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn works hard to support her family. She is married and has a food vending business in the Philippines.

Marilyn requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy additional ingredients and materials for her business, which she has been in for 13 years now.

In the future, Marilyn would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional ingredients and materials for her food vending business.

loans.name: Marivic

texts.en:
Marivic works hard to support her family. She is single and has a general store business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for five years now.

Marivic requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to buy more goods to sell in her general store.

In the future, Marivic would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more goods to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Creando Futuro Group

texts.es: Luis quien en la fotografía aparece al costado derecho agachado y con una chaqueta azul y un sus piernas, pertenece al Banco Comunal Creando Futuro ubicado en Villarrica. En este Banco Comunal los socios tienen variados negocios tales como la venta de ropa nueva, venta de sándwich y reloj. El negocio de Luis es venta de ropa y juguetes, el cual comenzó hace un tiempo por necesidad y porque  aprendió cuando iba a la feria. El desafío que tiene es poder establecerse con su negocio de ropa. El dinero que está solicitando es para poder comprar más ropa; sabe que le irá muy bien ya que tiene mucha clientela. Y lo que más le ha gustado de poder trabajar junto a Fondo Esperanza es el hecho de poder optar a un crédito.
texts.en: In the photo, Luis appears on the right side, crouched down on his legs, and he is wearing a blue jacket.  He belongs to the “Creando Futuro” [Creating the Future] Communal Bank located in Villarrica. The members of this communal bank have various businesses such as selling new clothing, sandwiches, and clocks.  Luis’s business is selling clothing and toys, which began some time ago out of necessity and because he had learned it when he went to the fair.  His challenge is to be able to establish himself in his clothing business.  He will use the money that he is requesting to purchase more clothing, and he knows that the business will go well because he has many customers.  What has pleased him the most about being able to work together with “Fondo Esperanza”, is being able to apply for a loan.

loans.use: to purchase clothing and toys for sale.

loans.name: Elda Marleny

texts.es:
Elda, es casada, vive con su esposo, dos hijos y un nieto, para sur un apoyo para su esposo desde hace 5 años se dedica a vender leña y también hace tortillas y antojitos para vender, hasta la fecha no ha tenido ninguna dificultad.
Elda comprara leña por mayor para luego revenderla a sus clientes, espera mantener activo su negocio, atraer más clientes, aumentar sus ventas y obtener ganancias extras para cancelar las  cuotas de su préstamo y cubrir sus gastos familiares.
Sueña con instalar un chalet para tener más ganancias y mejorar su economía.
texts.en:
Elda is married. She lives with her husband, two children and a grandchild. In order to help her husband she has sold firewood for five years. She also makes tortillas and snacks to sell. So far, she hasn't had any trouble. 

Elda will buy firewood to re-sell to her customers. She hopes to keep her business active, attract more customers, increase her sales and obtain extra profits to make the loan payments and cover her family expenses. She dreams of setting up a locale to make more profits and improve her finances.

loans.use: to buy firewood wholesale.

loans.name: Eliazar Bladimir

texts.es:
Eliazar, es un agricultor en pequeño, vive junto a sus padres y tres hermanos, es soltero, no tiene ayuda del extranjero, ayuda con los gastos familiares y lo hace con los ingresos que obtiene en la venta de pipián, es un oficio que aprendió de su familia, lo hace de forma independiente desde hace un año en un horario de 6:00 a.m. a 11:30 p.m., de lunes a viernes. No representa dificultades en su negocio.
El capital lo invertirá en la compra de abono, semilla, herbicidas, plaguicidas e insecticidas. Lo que le ayudara a preparar el terreno para la siembra y proteger el cultivo de plagas, espera aumentar la producción, mejorar las ventas y tener las ganancias necesarias para cubrir sus gastos personales y continuar aportando en su hogar.
Sueña con tener un negocio más rentable para continuar estudiando y dar a su familia un estilo de vida diferente.
texts.en:
Eliazar is small farmer. He lives with his parents and three siblings. He is single and has no help from abroad. He helps his parents with the household expenses and he does this with his income from selling pipián chiles. He learned this trade from his parents and has done it independently for a year. His schedule is from 6:00 a.m. till 11:30 p.m. Monday through Friday. He does not report andy difficulties with his business. 

He will invest the capital in buying fertilizer, seeds, herbicides, pesticides and insecticides. This will help him prepare the soil for planting and protecting the crop from pests. He hopes to increase production, improve sales and have the earnings he needs to cover his personal expenses and continuing contributing to the household. He dreams of having a more profitable business to continue studying and giving his family a different lifestyle.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, seeds, herbicides, pesticides and insecticides.

loans.name: Marivic

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Marivic works hard to support her family.

She has a food vending business in the Philippines, and she earns additional income from a general store. Marivic is borrowing 5000 PHP through NWTF to buy additional ingredients and materials for her food vending business.

Marivic has been sustaining her business activities through her past loan from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional ingredients and materials for her food vending business

loans.name: Marlona

texts.en:
Marlona, 33, has a live-in partner and six children. With two children currently in school, Marlona works very hard to provide for them.

Marlona runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a loan of 5,000 Philippine pesos through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation. She will use the loan to buy more stock to sell in her general store.

Marlona has been in this business for two years and sells a variety of items, such as detergent, bath soap, toothpaste, canned goods and sugar. She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell in her general store

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy ingredinets.

loans.name: Uyalkan

texts.ru: Уялкан 67 лет, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитали 9 детей. Все дети женаты, живут самостоятельно. У Уялкан - среднее образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи Уялкан занимается животноводством, стартовав 43 года назад, с покупки скота на 200 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Уялкан, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 1 жеребенок,, 1 бычок, 1 теленок, 15 овец. Ежемесячный доход составляет 9,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Уялкан обратилась в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом - на покупку овец для увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита Уялкан планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, и планирует накопить средства на строительство нового дома.
texts.en: Uyalkan is 67 and married with nine children, all of whom are married and live on their own. Uyalkan has a high school education and works in animal husbandry as the primary source of income for her family, a business she began 43 years ago with the purchase of livestock for 200 KGS. Thanks to her hard work, she now has one foal, one steer, one calf and 15 sheep, with a monthly income of 9,000 KGS. With the goal of further developing her business, Uyalkan has turned to microfinance bank Bai Tushum and Partners for a loan to purchase additional sheep. She plans to invest profits from the loan into further increasing her quantity of livestock, and to put some money toward building a new house.

loans.use: to buy sheep

loans.name: Liana

texts.en:
Liana is a 34-year-old woman, who lives with her parents in the village of Melauri, in Samtredia district. Her father is a driver in cleaning services and he generates GEL 280 monthly. Liana's mother gets a disability pension from the local government. 

As it becomes harder to earn a living on this income, Liana decided to start her own activity, in particular, to start trading in men's and women's clothing. 

Liana couldn’t receive a loan from the local financial institutions because of their requirements to have business experience or stable revenue, until the Start Up program began, which is a joint initiative between Kiva and Credo. The program allows rural poor, like Liana, a chance to start or re-start a business. 

Liana requested a loan of GEL 1,000 to purchase products at wholesale prices and then resell them among her friends and villagers. This will give her a chance to earn income and become financially independent. Thanks to the Start Up program, Liana will be able to make savings and provide a better future for her parents.

loans.use: to start trading in clothing.

loans.name: Kristina

texts.en:
Kristina finished paying her previous loan on time and in full. She is requesting another loan for the same purpose.

Kristina is thanking all of you for your financial help and wishing you Happy Holidays:)

loans.use: To buy secondhand items to sell at the local market.

loans.name: Bujar

texts.en:
Bujar, age 37, is a member of the vulnerable ethnic community of Egyptian Albanians, and he lives in a city where the majority of this community lives. The city is known for having the largest market for the buying and selling of used clothing and other used items, and Bujar operates a small business selling used clothing. He has been engaged in this business for 15 years. He is pictured here with the small cart that he uses to transport his goods.

Bujar and his wife have four children between the ages of five and 12 years old.

Members of the Roma and Egyptian community have built their own market in addition to what the city has built for them. This market is very busy throughout the year. The quality of used items at the market is very good, particularly that of clothes, since some of the clothes are brand new items that have been sold to Roma and Egyptian buyers in kilograms by store owners in western neighbor countries.
 
This will be Bujar's first time applying for a loan. He will use his loan funds to stock up on inventory items.

loans.use: to stock up on second-hand clothing and other used items that he will offer for sale

loans.name: Dilovar

texts.ru: Диловар живет в районе Фархор. Ему 27 лет. У него своя семья - жена и двое маленьких дочерей, которым по 1,5 и 3 года. Диловар является мастером по стройке домов. Последние 9 месяцев он помогает брату в его животноводческом бизнесе. Диловар набрал достаточного опыта в выращивании бычков и теперь хотел бы открыть свой бизнес. Во дворе дома он имеет коровник, а также его начальный капитал составляет 900 долларов. К тому же у Диловара имеется участок земли и корм для скота он будет брать оттуда. Сейчас Диловар просит кредит, чтобы закупить 6 голов бычков. Он уже создал все условия для нового бизнеса, осталось только приобрести скот и начать бизнес. Он ждет вашей поддержки.
texts.en:
Dilovar lives in the region of Farkhor. He is 27 years old. He has is own family: a wife and two young daughters, who are 18 months and 3 years old. Dilovar is trained as a builder. For the last 9 months he has been helping his brother with his cattle rearing business. Dilovar gained significant experience in nurturing steers and now he would like to open his own business. 

He has a cowshed in his yard and has 900 dollars of starting capital. Dilovar also has a patch of land and he will grow food for the cattle on that land. Now Dilovar is asking for a loan to buy 6 bull-calves. He has already arranged everything required to start his new business and all he needs to do is to purchase the cattle and start the business. He awaits your support.

loans.use: buy cattle

loans.name: Hikmat

texts.ru: Хикмат добрая и порядочная женщина. Она замужем, но не имеет детей. Хикмат вместе с мужем несколько лет находилась в Российской Федерации. Они подрабатывали разнорабочим. Хикмат недавно вернулась на родину, и теперь хочет организовать свой бизнес и зарабатывать на родине. Она хочет организовать свой бизнес купле продажей детской одежды. Хикмат с такой целью обратилась в ИМОН за займом. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 3000 долларов США для покупки детской одежды, чтобы организовать новый бизнес. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en:
Hikmat is a kind and decent woman. She is married, but does not have children. For several years, Hikmat and her husband have been abroad in the Russian Federation. They work part-time as laborers. Hikmat recently returned to their homeland, and now wants to start her own business and to earn a living at home. She wants to establish her own business buying and selling children's clothing.

With this aim, Hikmat turned to IMON for a loan. She is requesting a loan of US$3,000 to purchase children's clothing, in order to start a new business.

loans.use: to buy children clothes for organizing a new business

loans.name: Marivic

texts.en:
Marivic works hard to support her family. She is married and has an electronic mobile load business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for four years now.

Marivic requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to purchase an additional amount of electronic mobile load to sell to her customers.


Marivic would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase an additional amount of electronic mobile load to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Leonor De Jesus

texts.es:
Leonor, necesita capital para invertir en surtir la tienda con lo que comprara bebidas, golosinas y granos básicos, aceite, jabón, detergente, etc., ya que son los productos que sus clientes buscan.
Con el préstamo anterior ella compro los mercadería con lo que fortaleció su negocio, tiene más clientes satisfechos, sus ganancias extras le permiten cancelar sus deudas y apoyar con los gastos familiares.
texts.en:
Leonor needs capital so she can stock her store and buy beverages, snacks, basic grains, cooking oil, soap, detergent, etc.  because these are the products that her customers are looking for.

She used the money from the previous loan to strengthen her business.  She has more satisfied customers and her extra income allows her to pay her debts and support her family expenses.

loans.use: to stock her store.

loans.name: Sayda Lisseth

texts.es: Sayda es originaria de la ciudad de León, casada. De 24 años de edad. Ella es estudiante en una de las universidades de la ciudad. Su esposo es profesional y desea que Sayda también lo sea. Él lo apoya en lo que sea para que cumpla su meta y sea una mujer profesional con éxito en la vida.  Su mayor sueño es culminar su carrera para garantizarse un mejor futuro. Solicita el crédito para pagar el curso de titulación, con el fin de obtener su licenciatura. Su plan es apoyar a su esposo en el hogar.
texts.en: Sayda is from Leon.  She is 24,married, and studies at the local university.  Her husband is a professional and wants Sayda to be one as well.  He supports her however he needs so she can meet her goal and become a successful woman in life.  Her greatest dream is to complete her studies to guarantee a better future.  She is asking for a loan to pay tuition so she can obtain her degree.  Her plan is to support her husband in the home.

loans.use: to pay tuition.

loans.name: Ainura

texts.ru: Айнуре 42 года, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитывают 4 детей. У Айнуры - среднее образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи Айнура занимается животноводством, стартовав 18 лет назад, с покупки скота на 2,000 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Айнуры, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 3 дойные коровы, 5 овец, дополнительно занимается полеводством, имеет 0,40 ГА поливной земли, на которой выращивает кукурузу, картофель. Ежемесячный доход составляет 5,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Айнура обратилась в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом - на покупку телят для увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита Айнура планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, и планирует накопить средства на дальнейшее обучение детей.
texts.en:
Ainura is 42 years old, married, and with her spouse is raising four children. Ainura has a secondary education. As a main source of income for her family, Ainura raises livestock, having begun 18 years ago with a livestock purchase of 2,000 som KGS. Thanks to her hard work, Ainura currently has on her homestead: three dairy cows, and five sheep, and additionally raises crops. She has 0.40 hectares of arable land, on which she grows corn and potatoes. Monthly income amounts to 5,000 som (KGS).

With the aim of further developing her homestead, Ainura turned to the microfinance bank Bai-Tushum and Partners for a loan - to buy calves for expanding her livestock count.

Ainura plans to invest income from the loan in further propagating the quantity of domestic animals, and plans to save money for the further education of her children.

loans.use: to buy calves

loans.name: Zulaikho

texts.ru: Зулайхо 40 лет, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитывают 3 детей. У Зулайхо - среднее образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи Зулайхо занимается животноводством и полеводством, стартовав 15 лет назад, с покупки скота на 10,000 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Зулайхо, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 3 дойные коровы, 12 овец, также обрабатывает 2,53 ГА земли, где в основном выращивает -кукурузу и клевер. Полученный урожай реализуют оптовым поставщикам. Ежемесячный доход составляет 10,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Зулайхо обратилась в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом - на покупку овец для увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита Зулайхо планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины.
texts.en:
Zulaikho is 40 years old, married, and with her spouse is raising three children. Zulaikho is a secondary education. As a main source of income for her family, Zulaikho raises livestock and crops, having begun 15 years ago with a livestock purchase of 10,000 som KGS. Thanks to her hard work, Zulaikho currently has on her farm: three dairy cows and 12 sheep, and also works 2.53 hectares of land, where she mainly grows corn and clover. She will sell the resulting crop to wholesalers. Monthly income amounts to 10,000 som (KGS).

With the aim of further developing her homestead, Zulaikho turned to the microfinance bank Bai-Tushum and Partners for a loan - to purchase sheep for expanding her livestock count.

Zulaikho plan to invest income from the loan in further propagating the quantity of domestic animals.

loans.use: to buy sheep

loans.name: Ernesto

texts.es:
Ernesto, se ha decidido por un nuevo crédito ya que es un medio que le facilita la realización de actividades dentro de su negocio en esta ocasión lo utilizara para cancelar mano de obra y una maquina desgranadora, para la recolección de la cosecha, de esta forma tendrá justo a tiempo su producto en casa.
El crédito anterior le facilito tener una cosecha abundante tanto que se ahorro la compra de granos en la época de verano, tuvo mejores ingresos, ha cancelado sus deudas y su familia se encuentra saludable. Sus hijos han aprendido el oficio de siembra de granos básicos.
texts.en:
Ernesto has decided to ask for another loan since it is a good way to facilitate the completion of his business activities. He is seeking this loan so that he can pay off his workers and a Sheller machine.  Both are used in harvesting his crops.

His previous loan helped facilitate the harvest and helped him earn enough money to purchase grains in the summer when they are cheaper.  He had a higher income, he paid off his debts, and his family is healthy.  Also, his children have learned how to plant and harvest basic grains.

loans.use: to pay off workers and a sheller machine.

loans.name: Zarrina

texts.ru: Заррина молодая замужняя женщнина в возрасте 25 лет. Она живет с мужем и трехлетним сыном в городе Худжанд. Ее муж занимается продажей машин. Сама Заррина сидит дома, но зарабатывает на жизнь. Она швея. Заррина по заказу шьет женские платья разных фасонов. Каждый ее заказ получается индивидуально красивым. Сейчас она просит кредит, чтобы расширить свое дело. На сумму кредита Заррина планирует купить новую швейную машинку и ускорить процесс своей работы. Таким образом она хочет увеличить количество своих клиенток.
texts.en: Zarrina is a young, married, 25 year old woman.  She lives with her husband and three year old son in the city of Khujand.  Her husband sells cars.  Zarrina stays home alone, but also earns a living as a seamstress.  Zarrina sews women's dresses of different styles to order.  Each of her orders has an individual beauty.  She is asking for a loan in order to expand her business.  With the money from the loan, Zarrina plans to purchase a new sewing machine and accelerate her work.  In this way, she hopes to increase her number of clients.

loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine.

loans.name: Mario Alcides

texts.es:
Mario, se dispone a recolectar la cosecha de maíz por lo que necesita capital para pagar mano de obra, que le ayudara a realizarlo.
A Mario la inversión anterior le dio buenos resultados como mejor cosecha, granos de calidad, ha cancelado su crédito y poco a poco ha ampliado el área de cultivo. Sus hijos le apoyan en las jornadas de trabajo.
texts.en:
Mario is getting ready to harvest his corn crops and he needs capital in order to pay the workers that will help him.

Mario's previous loan brought great results such as a better harvest, higher quality grains, he paid off the loan, and little by little he has increased his crop acreage.  His children help him do the work.

loans.use: to pay workers.

loans.name: Josefa
