Les bénéfices réalisés, lui permettront en plus de consolider son épargne, d’appui son mari dans la prise en charge des charges familiales surtout de la santé de leur fille.
texts.en:
This Banc Villageois was established on December 10, 2012. It is made up of women who are very eager to prosper their money-earning businesses.

There is a good connection between the members of the group. All women live in the same neighborhood, and their main business is retail and the transformation of local products.

Mrs. Fatou (on the right in the sitting row, raising her left hand) is the featured borrower. She's a woman very determined to expand her business. She's 29 years old, married, and the mother of one girl. 

She's in retail, more specifically she sells fabrics and fashion accessories. She gets her supplies in one of the capital's markets, and resell on credit, asking for an advance corresponding to one third of the total price. 

With this new loan, she will buy embroidered Wax fabrics and suits for men, in order to resell them during the year-end holidays.

Her profits will enable her to strengthen her savings and help her husband cover the family's expenses, especially those related to their daughter's healthcare.

loans.use: to buy embroidered Wax fabrics and suits for men

loans.name: Andriansyah

texts.en:
Andri lives in Bogor, a city located at a one-hour drive from Jakarta, the capital city. Bogor is known as the city of rain. As a husband living with his spouse and two other persons in the family house, Andri has a responsibility to support his family whose needs are growing day by day. Therefore, Andri wants to improve his small shop selling drinking water by the gallon, gas, and mobile phone airtime credits. 

Andri took his first loan from Kiva to process more transactions on mobile phone airtime credits especially on weekends when sales are at their peak. In the future, Andri has a goal: to expand his business by selling more items and find more business opportunities. In the photo, Andri is standing in front of his small stall. He really thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To process more mobile phone credit sales and bill payment transactions

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn is 32 years of age. She is married to Noel, who works as a farmer. The couple is thankful because they have been blessed with one school-aged child.

Marilyn is a responsible mother. As she put it, she will do everything for her family, and that's why she engaged herself in her school canteen. She usually sell "pancit", "sopas", snack foods, candies and soft drinks. At this moment, Marilyn wants to improve her business, but she lacks the necessary capital.

In this regard, Marilyn is asking for a loan amounting to PHP 10,000 to buy candies, snack foods, soft drinks and raw ingredients for the "sopas" and "pancit" she cooks and sells. Marilyn is hoping that she will improve her business with the help of her loan.

loans.use: to buy candies, snack foods, soft drinks and raw ingredients for the "sopas" and "pancit" she cooks and sells

loans.name: Emy

texts.en:
Emy, aged 43, is patiently managing a sari-sari  (variety) store in her village. The hardships of living prompted her to set up this business.

She really wishes to improve her sari-sari  (variety) store to be able to support her family, but this time, she suffers from a shortage of capital. With regards to her situation, she is asking for a loan of PHP 40,000 to buy biscuits, canned goods, noodles, soap, and soft drinks. 

She knows that she will increase her sales through additional merchandise she offers. Emy believes that the loan will help her to develop the business someday.

loans.use: to buy biscuits, canned goods, noodles, soap, and soft drinks for her general store

loans.name: Mona

texts.en:
This is Mona, 21-years-old and a resident of Taguig, Philippines. Her partner is Custodio, a driver and they have children. She and her partner manage their household while operating the business. She is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Mona operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is a retail store that sells inexpensive items, often with a single price for all items in the store. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a Php 5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of Php 500 in sales every day.

She is requesting a Php 9,000 loan to help her continue in the operation of her business. She will use the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory.

Mona dreams to be successful in business and hopes to have a happy and a better future.  She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed for her business.

loans.name: Abdusattor

texts.en:
Abdusattor is 21 years old. He is a very clever young man. He graduated school with excellence and good marks. He was one of the best pupils of his school. He likes math, computers, geography and other subjects. His classmates like him very much. 

Four years ago he entered the Tajik Commerce University. He is studying in the Accounts faculty. His parents’ incomes are too small to pay for his studies at the university. He is asking for a loan of 750 USD to pay for education. He awaits your support.

loans.use: To pay for education

loans.name: Manuel

texts.en: Manuel, who is 23-years-old and single, is a responsible child.  He is the operator of a motorcycle transport that has been in operation for three years.  He is a hard working man who aims to help his parents in generating income for their family needs.  Manuel has requested a loan of 5,000 PHP (Philippine pesos) to buy paint, sprockets and gasoline for the maintenance of his motorcycle.  He hopes to increase his profits so that he can sustain the financial needs of his parents, improve their standard of living, and save money for future emergencies.

loans.use: to buy paint, sprockets and gasoline for the maintenance of his motorcycle

loans.name: Shuhrat

texts.en:
Shuhrat was born in the year 1992. He is a student in his fourth year. Shuhrat studies at the Technology State University at the accounting faculty.

Shuhrat is not married and lives with parents. His parents do not have money to pay for his tuition, so Shuhrat is asking for a loan of 1,700 USD to pay for tuition. He awaits your support.

loans.use: to pay for tuition

loans.name: Dorita

texts.en:
Dorita is 58 years old and married with two children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. 

Dorita has a 'buy and sell' rice and feed business in the Philippines. Dorita requested a PHP 22,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more sacks of rice and feed to sell.

Dorita has been in this business for eight years. In the future, Dorita would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more sacks of rice and feed to sell

loans.name: Ade

texts.en:
Ade is a hardworking man who runs several small businesses including a motorcycle wash and an electronic credit business. He also has a small corn field. He joined Ruma because he wanted to start expanding to other business opportunities by selling mobile phone airtime credit. Ade is married and living with three persons in the family home. They live in Bogor, a city located at a one-hour drive from Jakarta, the capital city. 

After joining Ruma, Ade has access to a loan that he needs as working capital. His first loan from Kiva that he has repaid allowed him to process more transactions, selling mobile phone airtime credits especially on weekends when the sales are high. Ade feels excited to expand his current business and provide a bill payment service so he he is now taking out his second loan from Kiva. Ade really thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to have working capital to process more mobile phone credit sales and bill payment transactions on weekends

loans.name: Yulita

texts.en:
This is Yulita, 59, resident of Taguig, Philippines. She is married to Glorioso, who is a vendor, and they have children. She and her husband are managing their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to sustain their financial expenses.

Yulita is a coconut vendor. Most coconuts in the Philippines are sold by street vendors pushing deep wooden carts. The coconuts are served after one end of it is cut and one can just put a straw in it so that the nut also serves as the container itself.  Also, coconuts can be offered with the juice and the edible part of the coconut put into a plastic cup with a straw. Regular customers are those who are thirsty and those who want to refresh themselves from the heat of the sun. She also sells bean curd pudding for additional income. They earn a minimum of PHP 400 per day.

To help continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 8,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy coconuts and the ingredients of bean curd pudding for her business. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Yulita hopes that her business will continue to be successful and dreams that her children will have a good future. She meets with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week. The fellowship meeting is where she finds strength and inspiration from the Word of God they study.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for coconuts and the ingredients of bean curd pudding for her business.

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en:
This is Gemma, 45, resident of Dasmariñas, Cavite, Philippines. She is married and she has children. Together with her children, she manages their own household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Gemma operates a rug-making business. She mainly offers rugs, from those round palm sized ones, to the much larger doormats and other crafts that most rug-makers come up every day. As rugs are a major part of Filipino housekeeping and cleaning, rugs are one of the most common products that can be bought, sometimes even from a peddler while you are riding in a speeding jeepney down the highway. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of Php 500 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php 10,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy more raw materials like fabric, thread and other materials for her business. 

Gemma dreams of expanding her business and hopes that her family will have a better living. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her life and business every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for more raw materials like fabric, thread and other materials for her business.

loans.name: Shamshad

texts.en:
Shamshad lives in Lahore, Pakistan. She is a responsible mother of three children. Her husband owns a welding shop which is the only source of income for the family. Her husband wants to purchase welding equipment to work more efficiently and professionally. This will help him to work more in less time. 

However, he doesn't have enough money to purchase this welding equipment. Therefore Shamshad has requested a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan for her husband's shop. 

Shamshad hopes that the loan will be a productive one for her family and for her husband's shop. She dreams of providing quality education to her children. She also wants to put aside savings for their future.

loans.use: To purchase welding equipment so her husband can work efficiently.

loans.name: San José Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado San José está en su ciclo 8 del programa de comité de mujeres, 19 son las integrantes de las cuales todas trabajan en variadas actividades. Todas forman parte del programa de eliminación de pobreza, donde todas luchan por poder salir adelante e ir superando su pobreza.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Cristina, quien es una persona muy sacrificada y trabajadora, y comenta que se dedica a ser empleada doméstica, y que también vende carbón, y por medio de ambos trabajos está ayudando a su familia. Su sueño es algún día poder tener una despensa y así seguir trabajando y mejorando.
Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de carbón, y así poder cumplir con los pedidos de sus clientes.
texts.en:
The group San José is in the eighth loan cycle of its women´s committee program. It has 19 members, all of whom make a living doing various different activities. They are all part of the poverty elimination program, where they each fight to get ahead and overcome poverty.

One of the members is Cristina, who is a very selfless and hard-working person. She states that she makes a living as a housekeeper, and she also sells charcoal. Through both of these jobs, she is helping her family. 

Her dream is to one day be able to have a small grocery store and that way continue to work and improve. She is requesting this loan in order to invest it in the purchase of charcoal. That way, she will be able to fill her customers´ orders.

loans.use: to buy charcoal in order to sell it

loans.name: Joel

texts.es:
Joel está por terminar la carrera de Psicología, y comenta que su meta es ejercer esta profesión en algún centro de ayuda.
Su familia le apoya siempre, ya que sus padres siempre se han sacrificado por poder darles todo lo que necesitan a ella y a sus hermanos.
Pide de este préstamo para poder invertirlo en el pago de sus cuotas y de sus gastos de titulación. También agradece por la oportunidad que está recibiendo de poder cumplir sus metas y objetivos.
texts.en:
Joel is about to finish his Psychology degree, and says that his goal is to exercise this profession in a support center. His family always supports him, they have always sacrificed in order to give himself and his siblings everything that they need. 

He is requesting this loan in order to invest it in the payment of his university tuition and fees. He is also thankful for the opportunity he is receiving to meet his goals and objectives.

loans.use: to pay university tuition and fees

loans.name: Umriniso

texts.en: Umriniso is 24-years-old. She is married and has two children. She tries to always provide them with a good education and with this goal she decided to start a new business of animal husbandry. She studied at the course of ‘To Get Ahead’ of women organizations and acquired enough skills about businesses.  Her mother-in-law will help her with the business. She is asking for a loan of 5,000 Somoni to buy cattle for starting the new business. She awaits your support.

loans.use: To buy cattle for starting a new business

loans.name: Archelie

texts.en:
Archelie is a 24-year-old married woman from the town of Panglao, Bohol. She runs  a shop and sells fashion accessories in their  community. Her business started almost two years now. She is asking for a loan to buy additional materials like shells for her handicraft business, which are very essential in her livelihood activity. 

In the future, Archelie hopes to expand her business to have a sustainable livelihood and saves money for  the education of her young son.

loans.use: to buy additional materials like shells for her handicraft business

loans.name: Genesa

texts.en:
Genesa is a 47-year-old woman who hails from Maribojoc, Bohol. She runs a sari-sari (variety) store. Her business started 6 years ago.

She is asking for a loan to buy additional stock for the store like noodles, soda, canned goods, candies and toiletries to attract customers and increase her sales. 

In the future, Genesa hopes to expand her business to improve her livelihood status.

loans.use: to buy additional stock for the store like noodles, soda, canned goods, candies and toiletries

loans.name: Nodar

texts.en: Nodar is a 56-year-old man, who lives in the Tetritskaro district.  He lives with his brother, Berdia, who works as a private worker with a very low and unstable wage, due to the demand in the market, and generates approximately 250-300 GEL monthly.  Nodar is involved in agricultural activities.  He has chickens and trades with eggs at the local market.  However, income from this activity isn't enough to meet all his family's needs.  So, Nodar decided to be involved in another sphere parallel of agricultural activity. He requested a loan to purchase a secondhand car and start a taxi business.  All the financial institutions rejected his loan requests because of his unstable financial conditions and lack of experience.  After several unsuccessful attempts, Nodar applied for credit to MFO Credo.  His request was approved in the framework of the Start Up program, which is joint initiative with Kiva, permitting the rural poor to start or re-start businesses. To reach that goal, Nodar needs a loan of 3,500 GEL. He highly relies on the goodwill of the lenders and will appreciate their support in collecting the needed amount of the loan to maintain and develop his business.

loans.use: To buy a secondhand car and transport people as a taxi driver

loans.name: Uzma's Group

texts.en:
Uzma is a 32-year-old woman who lives in Lahore, Pakistan. She is a responsible mother of four. Her husband is a rickshaw driver. 

His rickshaw has not been working properly for a while, so he cannot generate any income. He wants to repair it as soon as possible, but he does not have the money to do so. Therefore Uzma, as a member of this group, has requested a loan from Kiva's partner, BRAC Pakistan, to help her husband cover the cost. This will help him continue his business. 

Uzma is very thankful to Kiva. In the picture, Uzma is raising her hand.

loans.use: to cover the cost of repairing a rickshaw.

loans.name: Elvie

texts.en:
Elvie is 41 and gifted with three children. She and her husband aim to become financially stable to be able for them to continue sending their children to school. With this in mind, she plans to strengthen her hog-raising business to earn sufficient income.

To address this matter, she is asking for a loan of 20,000 PHP to buy feeds, vaccines and vitamins for her hogs. She is hoping that someday she will further improve the business and make it profitable.

loans.use: to buy feeds, vaccines and vitamins for her hog raising business

loans.name: Julieta

texts.en:
This is Julieta. She previously accessed an 25,000 PHP loan that she used to buy party supplies, including party poppers, balloons, hats and souvenirs. Her earnings were a big help for the education of her children and in their personal, household and business expenditures.
 
She would like to apply for another 25,000 PHP loan for her to buy party supplies, including party poppers, balloons, hats and souvenirs. The more items displayed at the store the better. More items to sell will result in a better profit. Her profits from the business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs and educational expenses of her children. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Julieta hopes that her business will last longer and dreams to have a better living. She meets with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week. There she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for party supplies, including party poppers, balloons, hats and souvenirs

loans.name: Maya Elizabeth

texts.es:
Maya es una joven de 23 años de edad, dedicada a estudiar su carrera universitaria y, de manera alterna comenzó a vender productos por catálogo con el fin de generar ingresos para solventar sus gastos personales y sus estudios; la actividad la aprendió de manera empírica y hasta el momento le ha generado buenos resultados.
El propósito es invertir el dinero del crédito que solicita, en la compra de mercancía al por mayor (productos de aseo personal y del hogar, suplementos dietarios, multivitamínicos, productos de belleza, entre otros), así estará en la capacidad de satisfacer los gustos y requerimientos de sus clientes, logrando una mayor fidelización, lo que dará como resultado un incremento en las ventas y por ende, en los ingresos que percibe con su labor.
Maya manifiesta que su proyecto para un futuro cercano es ampliar la variedad de productos, con el que fin de incrementar su mercado objetivo y poder generar mejores utilidades, pues sueña con culminar su carrera profesional y convertirse en una empresaria exitosa, para mejorar sus condiciones de vida y bienestar.
texts.en:
Maya is a 23 year old woman who goes to college. She started another activity selling products via catalog in order to generate income to pay for her personal expenses and her studies. She learned this activity empirically and so far has generated good results. 

The purpose is to invest the loan she has asked for in buying merchandise wholesale, such as personal and home hygiene products, dietary supplements, multivitamins, beauty products and more. Then she will be able to meets the tastes and requirements of her customers, gaining more loyalty. This will result in an increase in sales, and therefore, in the income she earns from her labor.

Maya says that her project for the near future is to expand the variety of products in order to increase her target market and earn more profit. She dreams of finishing her major and becoming a successful business woman in order to improve her quality of life and her well being.

loans.use: to buy merchandise wholesale such as personal and home hygiene products, dietary supplements, multivitamins, beauty products, and more.

loans.name: Nune

texts.en:
Nune lives in Kapan in the Syunik region. She graduated from Yerevan State Polytechnic Institute, but since she got married she became engaged in taking care of her sons. Since 1997 she has worked as an accountant (she attended some accounting courses) at the school. Now her husband also works at the same school as a physical education teacher. Simultaneously with her work as an accountant, Nune has her own business. She has a shop where she sells a great range of items. Their family income is small, but they manage to provide for their family’s primary needs.

Nune requests a loan of 1.100.000 Armenian drams to buy kitchen and living-room furniture for her flat to make it more comfortable for her nice and small family.

loans.use: to buy kitchen and living-room furniture for her flat.

loans.name: Franck

texts.en: Frank is a 30-year-old Cameroonian who is married and has a one-year-old child. He has been in this business for more than two years, which makes him experienced and stable. His business is likely to succeed because it is located in an urban area with many potential customers. This loan will increase his profits by 16 percent. His standard of living will also improve.

loans.use: to buy perfumes and oil in large quantities for resale.

loans.name: Tamar

texts.en:
Tamar is 33 years old, single, and lives alone in a suburb of the capital. Tamar works as a waitress and gets a small monthly salary. 

To generate more income and meet her daily expenses, Tamar is going to start a clothing sales business. With the Kiva loan, she will go to Turkey (a neighboring country) and buy clothing and household items in bulk. Prices are lower in Turkey than in Georgia, and Tamar will make a good profit. Tamar’s regular clients will be her neighbors and co-workers. She will give them the option of paying later for their purchases. 

The loan will enable Tamar to earn a profit and save money to satisfy her everyday needs. She awaits your generosity.

loans.use: to start a clothing sales business.

loans.name: Gilbert

texts.en: Gilbert is a Cameroonian, aged fifty-two and married with eight children.  The oldest child is 21-years-old in the university while the youngest is three in nursery school. He has been in this business for over eight years which makes him very experienced and stable. His business is likely to succeed because it is located in an urban area with many potential customers. This loan will increase his turnover by seventy percent.

loans.use: to buy a mini industrial grinding machine to transform food stuff (cassava, yams, spices, etc.)

loans.name: Suriya's Group

texts.en:
Suriya is a 39-year-old housewife. She lives in Lahore, Pakistan. She is the mother of 4 children.

Her husband owns a grocery store in the market, which is the only source of income for the family. He sells a variety of items. Presently he is interested in offering more variety to his customers, which will help him to increase his net income and savings as well. However, due to the lack of funds, he finds it difficult. Therefore, his wife Suriya has requested a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan so that she can help her husband to purchase a variety of products to sell in the market at a profitable price.

With the profit amount, her husband wants to grow his business in the future. Suriya is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of products to sell in the main market at a profitable price

loans.name: Shehnaz's Group

texts.en:
Shehnaz, age 45, is the leader of this group. She adores her family, and her husband works very hard so his family can have a good and respectable life. Her husband provides electronic water pump repair services. 

Shehnaz has requested a loan from Kiva partner BRAC Pakistan with the goal of improving her husband's business. He will use the loan to buy copper electric coils to fix water pumps.

With the profits expected from this loan, he intends to increase his business so he can eventually construct a small house for his family. Shehnaz hopes the loan will be helpful for her husband's business. She is thankful to Kiva lenders and to BRAC Pakistan.

Note: In the picture Shehnaz is raising her hand.

loans.use: to buy copper electric coils so her husband can repair water pumps.

loans.name: Shamim

texts.en: Shamim, a 57-year-old hard-working woman, lives in Rawalpindi Pakistan with her husband, two sons and two daughters. One son and both daughters are studying, and her husband is an auto mechanic. His income is insufficient to meet the family's needs, so Shamim is trying to help him fulfill their needs by stitching clothes. She herself is a tailor, and she wants to generate more income by purchasing a new sewing machine. She will extend her business if she gets a good amount of profit in the future. Shamim has requested a loan from Kiva partner, BRAC Pakistan, to purchase a sewing machine to stitch more dresses and to satisfy the needs of her clients more professionally. She hopes, with the help of the loan, to reach her desired net income and be able to save for their future. She dreams of giving her children a quality education.

loans.use: To purchase a new sewing machine.

loans.name: Saira

texts.en: Saira is a 41-year-old hard-working housewife. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan with her husband and a daughter. Her husband is a security guard by profession but his monthly income is not enough to fulfill the household expenses of his family. Therefore, for the past five years, along with the profession of a security guard, he also drives a taxi at night.  Currently he is not able to generate any income from the taxi, as its engine is not working properly and needs to be repaired. Saira has requested a loan from Kiva partner, BRAC Pakistan, to meet the amount of repairing the engine of her husband's taxi. With the profit, her husband wants to open a new auto mechanic shop in the future. Saira desires to provide a quality education to her daughter and she prays for the good health of her family and for the growth of her husband's business . She is very much thankful to BRAC.

loans.use: To help her husband pay for repairing his taxi.

loans.name: Ramatoulaye's Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe est créé le 16 mai  2011 lors de l’inauguration leur banc villageois. Il compte actuellement des femmes qui en plus de vivre ensemble dans le même village, gagnent en expérience dans leur activité respective car comprenant de mieux en mieux le programme cela favorisé par le fait que le village habite un grand « Louma » marché hebdomadaire. La solidarité et entre aide caractérisent les relations entre membre du groupe qui ont comme activité principale le petit commerce.

Madame Ramatoulaye (debout  à l’extrême droite avec une main levée) est l’emprunteuse vedette. Mariée et mère de deux  garçons et quatre filles, elle est âgée de 42 ans. C’est une femme très dynamique et engagée dans la bonne marche du groupement. Elle est vendeuse d’articles vestimentaires : sacs, chaussures, tenues hommes et femmes et autres accessoires. Elle se procure la marchandise à la capitale par douzaine pour la revente au détail.

 Avec son nouveau prêt, elle va acheter des douzaines de chaussures à 40 000 Frs CFA la douzaine, des accessoires pour femmes.

 Avec les bénéfices, en moyenne 15 000 Frs CFA par douzaine vendue, elle pense renforcer son épargne et améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
The group was created May 16, 2011 during the inauguration of their "banc villageois" loan association . It currently comprises women who not only live together in the same village, but also acquire experience in their respective activities as they gain deeper understanding of the program, encouraged by the fact that the village is host to a big " Louma " weekly market. Solidarity and mutual help characterize the relationship between group members, whose main activity is small trade.

Mrs. Ramatoulaye (standing on the far right with her hand raised) is the featured borrower. Married and the mother of two boys and four girls, she is 42 years old. She is a very dynamic woman and committed to the proper running of the group.

She sells clothing items: bags, shoes, outfits for men and women and other accessories. She gets her merchandise in the capital by the dozen, for resale at retail prices.

With the new loan, she will buy dozens of shoes at 40,000 CFA francs per dozen, and accessories for women.

With the profits - on average 15,000 CFA francs per dozen sold - she plans to strengthen her savings and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: buy dozens of shoes at 40,000 CFA francs per dozen, accessories for women.

loans.name: Rigoberto De Jesús

texts.es:
Rigoberto, a sus 25 años de edad, se dedica a trabajar en el campo de la confección desde hace aproximadamente 2 años, aprendió el oficio gracias a las enseñanzas de su novia y comenzó a trabajar como empleado en una empresa, donde amplió sus conocimientos y obtuvo experiencia en la labor, luego decidió independizarse y montó un pequeño taller en la comodidad de su casa, allí, con tan solo una máquina plana presta sus servicios de confección a terceros; esto le ha permitido generar recursos para el sustento diario y para solventar los gastos del hogar.
El propósito con el crédito es completar el dinero para comprar otra máquina plana, con la que podrá agilizar más  su producción y estará en la capacidad de cumplir con la entrega de los pedidos de manera oportuna; abriendo la posibilidad de generar nuevos y más grandes contratos.
Rigoberto, con su espíritu de superación, tiene como proyecto a mediano plazo, ampliar su taller y acreditarlo con nuevas máquinas, que le permita generar empleo y mejorar la rentabilidad del negocio, para cambiar sus condiciones de vida y su bienestar.
texts.en:
Rigoberto is 25 years old. He has worked in the the area of sewing clothes for approximately 2 years. He learned the trade thanks to the teachings of his girlfriend and started to work as an employee in a business where he widened his knowledge and obtained experience in the field. Later he decided to go off on his own and he opened a small workshop conveniently in his house. There, with just one sewing machine he offers his services to third parties. This has allowed him to generate resources for his daily support and the household expenses. 

The purpose of the loan is to have enough money to buy another sewing machine. With it, he will be able to speed up his production more and he will be able to finish delivering the orders in a timely manner. This will open up the possibility of generating newer and bigger contracts. 

Rigoberto, with his spirit of overcoming, has a project for the medium term of expanding his workshop and getting it more machines. This will allow him to generate employment and improve the business' profitability so that he can change his quality of life and his well being.

loans.use: to have enough money to buy another sewing machine

loans.name: Averson Juneral

texts.es:
Averson, a sus 44 años de edad, es padre soltero de un hijo de 4 años a quien ha sacado adelante con gran esfuerzo. Durante su vida productiva ha trabajado en diversas actividades pero, con el fin de mejorar los ingresos, decidió emprender su propio negocio de venta de comidas rápidas y fritos, actividad que realiza desde un local arrendado y que aprendió de su madre; trabaja con el apoyo de una empleada desde las 7 am hasta las 8 pm; así ha logrado sustentar las necesidades básicas de su hijo y las propias.
El crédito que solicita es para invertirlo en la compra de una vitrina calentadora, utensilios de cocina e insumos al por mayor (carnes frías, salsas, gaseosas, empanadas, entre otros), esto le permite tener una mejor exhibición de sus productos y podrá ofrecer más variedad de alimentos para satisfacer los diversos gustos de sus comensales; logrando así un incremento en las ventas y en los ingresos que recibe por su labor.
Averson manifiesta que su propósito a mediano plazo es ampliar el local para tener más espacio en el que sus clientes estén más cómodos, además sueña con poder adquirir el local para seguir su negocio pero de una manera mucho más rentable, así podrá dar una educación con calidad a su hijo y mejorará el bienestar familiar.
texts.en:
Averson is 44 years old. He is a single father of a 4 year old whom he has gotten ahead with a lot of effort. During his work life, he has worked at different activities. However, in order to improve his income, he decided to start his own business selling fast food and fried products. He learned this activity from his mother. He works with the help of an employee from 7 a.m. until 8 p.m. This is how he has been able to pay for his and his son's basic needs.

The loan he has asked for is to invest in buying a heated display case, kitchen utensils and ingredients wholesale (deli meats, sauces, sodas, empanadas, and more). This allows him to have better display of his products and he will be able to offer more food variety for the diverse tastes of his diners. This will lead to an increase in sales and income from his work.  

Averson says that his aim in the medium term is to expand his locale and have more space for his customers to be more comfortable. He also dreams of being able to acquire the locale to continue in his business but in a more profitable way. This way, he will be able to give his son a quality education and improve his family's well being.

loans.use: to buy a heated display case, kitchen utensils, and ingredients wholesale (deli meats, sauces, sodas, empanadas, and more)

loans.name: Belemnaaba Group

texts.fr:
Mme TALATO est responsable du groupe BELEMNAABA.  Marié, elle est mère 4enfants. Le plus âgé 26ans et le moins âgé 11ans. 04 vont à l’école.
Mme des légumes  depuis 08ans. Elle s’approvisionne dans les marchés  environnants. Ses clients sont les hommes et les femmes.
Elle veut s’acheter 01sac d’oignon, 01sac de choux et 01 panier de tomate.
Mme veut épargner ses bénéfices et aider à la scolarisation des enfants. Elle ambitionne agrandir son activité de vente de légumes.
texts.en:
Mrs. TALATO is the head of the BELEMNAABA group. She is married with four children aged 11 to 26 who all go to school. 

She has been selling vegetables for 8 years. She buys her stock at local markets and sells to both men and women. 

She plans to buy one bag of onions, one bag of cabbages and one basket of tomatoes. 

Her goals are to save her profits and to support her children’s education. She would also like to expand her activity.

loans.use: to buy one bag of onions, one bag of cabbages and one basket of tomatoes.

loans.name: Juliane

texts.en:
Juliane, 31, came from the south because her family wanted a better life. She has a 2 year old daughter and lives with her mother and her sister. Juliane and her sister are responsible for taking care of the family financially. Juliane sells clothes, but today her business does not earn much profit and Juliana would like to earn a higher percentage of income on clothing sales. With the money she plans to buy the clothes directly from factories and so have a much larger profit on goods sold.

She is a person who loves to talk, is always smiling and is a very dedicated mother and daughter. With this she helped her mother overcome depression.

loans.use: to buy clothes, shoes and accessories

loans.name: Joy Lom Group

texts.en:
“My life when I was with my husband still haunts me and makes me sick,” shares Elizabeth. She is a divorcee, and she is the featured borrower member for Joy Group. She is pictured with her hand raised. Her husband’s continual mental harassment and torture still haunt her, even though it has been five years that they are separated. 

The group resides in a small town, which is about 62 kms from from the main capital town of Imphal. All of the group members stood for each other in terms of moral and financial assistance.

Elizabeth runs a paan-dukan in the neighbourhood.  She sells small sachets of different edible items like potato chips and popcorn, and also shampoo, detergent soap and detergent powder. Paan (a mixture of betel leaves, nuts and dry tobacco leaves) are the main item that sells the most in the neighbourhood. The generated income is small, but she manages to roll the business well and fine. However, she could not possibly try the shop expansion because of lack of capital money. Besides, she also takes care of her brother’s kid and provides school fees on a monthly basis.

With the Kiva loan, she will purchase more supplies for the shop to generate more income. She also managed to repay her previous loan successfully. She says that if Kiva continues to support the women’s group and continues building relationships, she is sure to expand her shop and turn it into a variety shop. She says, “Thank you Kiva.”

The rest of the group members are also engaged in a paan shop, hotel, weaving, selling tobacco juices and running a stamp shop.

loans.use: to purchase more stock like milk powder, cereals and betel nuts/leaves to sell to make an income and support the child's education.

loans.name: Agapita

texts.en:
Agapita is a 54-year-old married woman  from the town of Tagbilaran City, Bohol. She runs a sari-sari (variety) store. She sells  various items like noodles, biscuits, soap, canned goods and dry goods. Her business started more than  a year ago. She is asking for a loan to buy  more stock like beverages, eggs, cooking ingredients, dry goods and toiletries. 



In the future, Agapita hopes to expand her business and increase business profitability for sustainable livelihood.

loans.use: to buy  more stock like beverages, eggs, cooking ingredients, dry goods and toiletries

loans.name: Billy

texts.en: Due to financial hardships, Billy engages in raising ducks to lay eggs for sale. He is 42 years old and has three children. He aims to improve the business and earn sufficient income to satisfy their necessities and support the education of his children. To give proper nutrition to his ducks, he is asking for a loan of PHP 12,000 to buy the needed feed and nets for his ducks. He is hoping that his loan will enable him to improve the business so he can keep his poultry business and obtain better income.

loans.use: to buy feedsand nets for his ducks

loans.name: Rowena

texts.en:
Rowena works hard to support her family. Rowena is married and has a business buying and selling dried fish in the Philippines.

Rowena requested a PHP 28,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more boxes of dried fish to sell to her customers.

Rowena has been in this business for ten years now.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Rowena would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more boxes of dried fish to sell to her customers

loans.name: Tatul

texts.en:
Tatul is 21 years old and he lives in the village of Geghi in Syunik region. This active young man lives with his grandfather, and with him Tatul is seriously engaged in farming and agricultural activities. As Tatul says, he loves his grandfather very much, a very wise, honest person and skillful farmer. With his grandfather he takes care of five cows and ten beehives; they also cultivate a plot of land. 

As a result of their great efforts and day and night work, they manage to sell milk, meat, honey, and also potatoes, beans, cabbage, carrots and nuts. They sell their produce at the city wholesale market through the re-sellers.

Tatul is very worried about his cattle fodder during the winter months and he is asking for a loan of 950.000 Armenian drams in order to buy fodder and also  several hives for their bees.

loans.use: to buy fodder and several hives for their bees

loans.name: Artush

texts.en:
Artush lives in Kapan city which is in Syunik region. He is married and he has a two-year-old daughter. Artush graduated from Kapan State Polytechnic Institute. For several years he worked as a salesman at a car spare parts shop; now he works at a stone workshop. His wife works at a college and his mother works at a kindergarten. Because of sickness, his father does not work and he receives a pension. 

Artush lately managed  to partly repair his flat and he is asking for a loan of 1,000,000 Armenian drams in order to buy furniture for his flat.

loans.use: to buy furniture for his flat in order to improve his living conditions

loans.name: Tuliya Group

texts.fr: La Cliente Zihalirwa est une commerçante d’une expérience de 10 ans, âgée de 41 ans et mère de 10 enfants dont  6 étudient et 4 autres sont encore gosses. La cliente est membre d’un collectif d’Affaires « Tuliya». Elle est vendeuse de friperie. Elle installe ses marchandises dans le marché animé de la ville. Elle sollicite un prêt auprès de Hekima pour accroitre son activité. Elle va acheter 1 ballon de friperie. Son conjoint est un technicien des meubles (Menuisier). Elle démarra ses affaires avec le fonds  reçu de son mari. Dans l’avenir, elle souhaite accroitre son crédit, scolariser et nourrir ses enfants. Elle remercie Hekima pour son soutien aux femmes entrepreneurs non bancables en leur accordant de microcrédit, pendant, ce moment poste conflits dans la région de l’Est du pays. Il sied de signaler quelques clientes portent leurs bébés.
texts.en:
This client, Zihalirwa, is a merchant with ten years of experience. She is 41 years old and a mother of ten children, of whom six are students, and four others are still very young. This client is a member of the business collective "Tuliya". She sells secondhand clothing. She sets up her merchandise at the town's busy market. 

Zihalirwa is requesting a loan from Hekima to grow her business. She is going to purchase a bale of secondhand clothing. Her husband is a furniture technician (carpentry). She had started her business with funds from her husband. For the future, she would like to increase her loan and provide education and food for her children. 

She thanks Hekima for its support of unbanked women entrepreneurs by according them microloans during this time post-conflict in the country's east. It should be noted that a few clients are carrying their babies.

loans.use: to purchase a bale of secondhand clothing

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Bushra's Group

texts.en:
Bushra is 40 years old and a housewife. She lives in Lahore, Pakistan. She is a mother of four children. Her husband owns a grocery store in the market which is the only source of income for the family. He sells a variety of goods. Presently he is interested in offering more variety to his customers which will help him to increase his net income and savings as well. However due to the lack of funds, he finds it difficult. 

Therefore his wife Bushra, as a member of a two-person lending group, has requested a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan, so that she can help her husband to purchase a variety of products like sugar, rice, biscuits, beans, cooking oil, etc  to sell in the market at a profitable price. With the profit her husband wants to grow his business in the future. Suriya is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of products for her husband to sell

loans.name: Drita

texts.en:
Drita is a mother of two children and is a housewife, spending most of her time taking care of their children and home. She, her husband and her children live with the entire family, including her husband’s brother, wife and his children in the same home. They are very poor and live in very bad conditions. Her husband is the main source of income and cuts wood to sell to others in his community for heating their homes. 

Drita is in need of a loan in order to renovate and insulate her house. She believes that this loan will help her to improve the living conditions of her family and provide more comfort to them, especially in the cold, windy and wet winters. She is very happy to have the possibility of getting a loan and wants to thank all of the Kiva lenders!

loans.use: to renovate and insulate her house.

loans.name: Ismeil

texts.en:
Ismeil is 58 years old. He lives in the village of Chikaani with his wife. Ismeil is busy with agricultural activities. He grows grapes in his own vineyard and maize on the plot of land. He works hard the whole year and harvests the quality products, which are sold to fruit and vegetable retailers. 

With this loan, Ismeil would like to purchase a tractor. He will use it to perform agricultural work on the land of nearby farmers, mainly in tilling and sowing seasons, and will be paid by the landlords. 

Ismeil has a strong will to generate income. He expects that this loan will significantly increase his family's funds and enable him to provide better living conditions for his family.

loans.use: to purchase a tractor and use it to perform agricultural work on the land of local farmers.

loans.name: Malkhaz

texts.en:
Malkhaz is a 56-year-old married man who lives in Tbilisi, the capital of Georgia. He has a wife, a daughter, a daughter-in-law and a son. Every member of the family, except Malkhaz, is employed. His wife works as a cashier at the university canteen. His daughter and daughter-in-law are sales ladies and his son is a distributor. They are really hardworking persons who do everything to improve the family's living conditions. 

Malkaz hates doing nothing all day and being dependent on the income of other family members. He has a great desire to start his own activity. The startup program that is joint initiative between Kiva and Credo enables him to get a loan of $ 2,000 for purchasing a second-hand car. Malkhaz will serve the local people as a taxi driver and transport them inter-city. He is a very enthusiastic and hardworking person with a great desire to do his bit for the welfare of the family. Malkhaz is thankful to Kiva Lenders for giving him a chance to generate income.

loans.use: To buy a car for starting a taxi business.

loans.name: Benit Group

texts.fr:
Mme BOUANPOUNDI est responsable du groupe BENIT. Marié, elle est mère 04enfants. Le plus âgé 22ans et le moins âgé 13ans. 04 vont à l’école.
Mme vend de l’eau, des pagnes, draps et bazins depuis 04ans. Elle s’approvisionne au à BOBO. Ses clients sont les hommes et les femmes.
Elle veut s’acheter 01douzaine de pagnes, 01douzaine de draps et une douzaine de bazins.
Mme veut épargner ses bénéfices. Elle ambitionne ouvrir un grand magasin.
texts.en:
Ms. BOUANPOUNDI is the official of the group BENIT. She is a married mother of four children. The oldest is 22, and the youngest is 13. Four go to school. 

Ms. BOUANPOUNDI has been selling water, 'pagnes' (the colorful cloth of western Africa), bed sheets, and damask fabrics for four years. She gets her supplies from BOBO. Her customers include both men and women. She wants to purchase a dozen lengths of 'pagne' cloth, a dozen bed sheets, and a dozen lengths of damasks. She wants to save her profits. Her ambition is to open a big store.

loans.use: to purchase 'pagne' cloth, bed sheets, and damask fabrics

loans.name: Mujeres Unidas Group

texts.es:
El grupo Mujeres Unidas  está en su ciclo número 4º del programa de comité de mujeres, donde todas trabajan y se ayudan por salir adelante. Están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, donde 2 de las integrantes tienen ingresos muy bajos, por lo que se están esforzando al máximo por poder superarse.
Mirta, una de las miembros, comenta que es vendedora de chipas y pan, también se debe destacar el trabajo de las asesoras, quienes hacen un seguimiento permanente de capacitaciones y verificaciones. Ella es una persona que está luchando por crecer, y de esa forma poder dar a su familia todo lo que ella no pudo tener. Uno de sus sueños es poder tener un local donde hacer sus ventas y de esa forma no tener que hacerlo de forma ambulante.
La Sra. Mirta solicita de este crédito para la compra de sus ingredientes para la realización de sus chipas y pan lo que le ayudará a concretar su plan de negocio, el cual le ayudará a mejorar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
The group Mujeres Unidas ("United Women") is in its fourth loan cycle in the women´s committee program, where they work and help each other to get ahead. They are doing a poverty elimination survey, where two of the members were shown to have a very low income, which is why they are working to the maximum to be able to overcome this. 

Mirta, one of the members, says that she sells cheesy buns and bread for a living. She also highlights the work of the poverty program consultants, who continuously monitor and verify the trainings. She is a person who is fighting to grow, and be able to give her family everything that she could not have. One of her dreams is to be able to have a store from which she can make her sales. That way, she would not have to make her sales on foot.

Mirta is requesting this loan for the purchase of the ingredients to make cheesy buns and bread, which will help her to carry out her business plan and thus improve her income.

loans.use: To buy ingredients for the preparation of bread and cheesy buns

loans.name: Aida's Group

texts.fr: Ce groupe de 4 femmes fait partie d'un Banc Villageois qui a été créé le 29 Mars 2008. Elles habitent le même quartier, sont en bonne entente et la solidarité constituent leur force. Leurs principales activités sont le commerce. Aïda, debout à droite sur la photo et levant la main est âgée de 45 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de 02 fille et 02 garçons. Elle fait comme activité la vente de tissus et de chaussures. Elle a une très bonne expérience dans ce domaine. Elle va dans les grandes villes où elle s'approvisionne en tissus, en chaussures et du lait. Elle compte acheter 100000F CFA pour 10 casiers de 48 boites de lait, 100000 F de tissus, 75000 F de chaussures et le reste va lui servir de fond de roulement. Avec les bénéfices réalisés, elle va renforcer son épargne et assurer les frais d'études de ses enfants
texts.en:
This group of four women belongs to a Banc Villageois that was created March 29, 2008. They live in the same neighborhood, get along well, and their solidarity is their strength. They conduct commercial activities. 

Aïda, age 45, is the group member standing on the right and raising her hand. She is the married mother of two boys and two girls. She sells fabrics and shoes, and she has extensive experience in this sector. She travels to large cities to purchase fabrics, shoes and milk. 

With this loan, she plans to buy 10 cases of 48 cartons of milk for 100,000F CFA, 100,000 F worth of fabrics, and 75,000 F worth of shoes. The remainder of her loan will be used as working capital. She will use her profits to bolster her savings and to cover her children’s tuition fees.

loans.use: to buy fabrics, shoes and milk.

loans.name: Dima's Group

texts.fr: Ce groupe est composé de 23 femmes. Elles habitent le même village et ont comme activités principales l'élevage et le petit commerce. Fama est la représentante du groupe, elle est âgée de 46 ans. Elle est mariée mère de deux filles et 01 garçon. Elle mène une activité de petit commerce et a une bonne expérience de plus de 03 ans dans ce domaine.Elle est debout sur la photo à droite et a levé la main. Elle achète du sucre, des arachides séchés, des sachets d'eau qu'elle revend sur la route nationale ou elle a une place avec sa petite table. Elle envisage avec son prêt acheter pour 03 sacs d'arachides, dix kilos de café, du sucre et des sachets d'eau et espère se faire ainsi beaucoup de revenus à la vente.Son activité, marche bien. Avec ses bénéfices, elle compte renforcer son épargne afin de bénéficier d'un prêt plus élevé et aussi avoir son autonomie financière.
texts.en:
This group is composed of 23 women. They live in the same village, and their main work involves livestock farming and small-scale commerce. Fama is the group's representative. She is 46 years old, married, and the mother of two girls and a boy. She has a small business and good experience of over three years in this domain. She is standing at the right in the photo with her hand raised. She buys sugar, dried peanuts, and pouches of water that she resells along the nation's main road where she has a spot for her little table. 

Fama envisions using this loan to purchase 3 sacks of peanuts, 10 kg of coffee, some sugar, and pouches of water. Thus, she hopes to bring in a lot of revenues from the sales. Her business is going well. With the profits, she plans on bolstering her savings in order to benefit from a larger loan and also to be financially autonomous.

loans.use: to purchase peanuts and local coffee

loans.name: Cerenisa

texts.en:
Cerenisa provides transportation services to earn a living and has been doing this for four years, earning well for the family's needs. 

She was able to repay her previous loan successfully. She used her previous loan to purchase tires and repairs to improve the services provided.

Recently, she borrowed a new loan to cover maintenance costs. In the future, she hopes to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to cover maintenance costs.

loans.name: Concepcion

texts.en: Concepcion helps her husband in their fishing business for a living.  She has been doing this for more than ten years earning well for the family and she was able to repay her previous loan successfully. She used her previous loan to purchase fishing nets to improve her business. Recently, she borrowed a new loan from GDMPC micro credit to repair her boat used for fishing. Positively, she hopes to be able to expand her business.

loans.use: to repair her boat

loans.name: Peregrina

texts.en:
Peregrina owns and operates a business, tailoring and selling clothing products to local businesses and community members. She also makes curtains and pillowcases to earn more income. 

She earns well from this business and she was able to successfully repay her previous loan. She used her previous loan from Gata Daku Multi-Purpose Cooperative (GDMPC) to purchase materials for her business. 

Recently, Peregrina borrowed a new loan to purchase more fabrics to make curtains and pillows. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more fabrics.

loans.name: Edralyn

texts.en:
Edralyn is 30 years old, married, and has two children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Edralyn has been raising pigs for two years and also earns additional income from buying and selling coconut candy.

Edralyn is borrowing PHP 18,000 through NWTF to purchase vaccines, feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase vaccines, feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Rowena

texts.en:
Rowena is a married woman with three children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Rowena is 39 years old and two of her children are still in school.

Rowena has a food vending business in the Philippines. Rowena requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF for food vending.

Rowena has been in this business for 2 years. In the future, Rowena would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like vegetables, meat, spices, seasonings, etc. for her food vending business.

loans.name: Melanie

texts.en:
Melanie works hard to support her family. Melanie is single and has a general store business in the Philippines.

Melanie requested a PHP 8,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stocks like canned goods, laundry soap, shampoo, sugar, coffee, etc. to sell.

Melanie has been in this business for 5 years now.

In the future, Melanie would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks like canned goods, laundry soap, shampoo, sugar, coffee, etc. to sell.

loans.name: Bebnie

texts.en:
Bebnie is 40 years old and has three children. Bebnie is married and all three of her children are in school.

Bebnie is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Bebnie requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Bebnie has been raising pigs for 10 years now and has borrowed 12 times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

Bebnie would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Ranko

texts.en:
Ranko lives in a minority community in Kosovo and is a 55-year-old married father of two grown children, one boy and one girl. He works as veterinarian and serves all of the nationalities and people that are living in Kosovo, while his wife is a housewife taking care of their home. 

Ranko’s son recently got married and they are living in the same house. Therefore, Ranko is requesting a loan in order to purchase the necessary building materials for renovating the second floor such as shingles, gravel, and cement. This will allow his son to be able to live separately with his wife and future family. He believes that this loan will help to improve the overall living conditions and environment for his family as Ranko dreams to have a finished home to enjoy with his family in a healthy and comfortable environment. He wants to thank all of the lenders!

loans.use: To purchase the necessary building materials for renovating the second floor.

loans.name: Ibush

texts.en:
Ibush, 24, comes from a minority Ashkali community.  His wife is a housewife and stay-at-home mother, taking care of their child and the home. Although Ibush works hard, they are very poor. In order to earn a living, he transports goods and materials for others for fee. 

He is now requesting a loan from KosInvest in order to purchase a horse carriage to help him to transport the goods and to renovate his stable. He is hoping that in the future he will be able to add an additional horse and improve the living conditions and quality of life for his family. He hopes that his children will have a better education and opportunities and wants to thank all Kiva lenders!

loans.use: To purchase a horse carriage to help him to transport goods.

loans.name: Sobia

texts.en:
Sobia is 32 years old and a housewife. She is living in Rawalpindi, Pakistan with her family. Her husband has owned a hotel for five years, which is the only source of income for their family. 

Sobia, has requested a loan from Kiva partner, BRAC Pakistan, to purchase materials for her husband's hotel, like flour, rice, pulses, and vegetables.

She is very hopeful that the loan will be a productive one for them and will bring a positive change to their monthly income.

loans.use: to pay for items, like flour, rice, pulses, and vegetables.

loans.name: Alonso's Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe est créé le 16 mai  2011 lors de l’inauguration leur banc villageois. Il compte actuellement des femmes qui en plus de vivre ensemble dans le même village, gagnent en expérience dans leur activité respective car comprenant de mieux en mieux le programme cela favorisé par le fait que le village habite un grand « Louma » marché hebdomadaire. La solidarité et entre aide caractérisent les relations entre membre du groupe qui ont comme activité principale le petit commerce.

Madame Alanso (debout  à l’extrême droite avec une main levée) est l’emprunteuse vedette du groupe. Elle est mariée et mère de quatre enfants dont deux  garçons et deux filles âgés de 09 à 26 ans. C’est une dame très active dans le banc villageois. Elle tient une table de légumes et condiments au marché de la commune. Elle se procure les légumes au marché régional du sud pour les revendre en détail par tas ou mesure selon les besoins du client.

Avec son nouveau prêt, elle compte acheter de l’ognon et des pommes de terre au moins deux sacs de 20 Kg pour chaque produit et divers assaisonnements.

 Avec les bénéfices, elle compte participer très activement à la gestion des charges familiales d’une part et d’autre part accroître son épargne.
texts.en:
The group was created May 16, 2011 during the inauguration of their "banc villageois" loan association. It currently comprises women who not only live together in the same village, but also acquire experience in their respective activities as they gain deeper understanding of the program, encouraged by the fact that the village is host to a big " Louma " weekly market. Solidarity and mutual help characterize the relationship between group members, whose main activity is small trade.

Madame Alanso (standing on the far right with a raised hand) is the group's featured borrower. She is married and the mother of four children, two boys and two girls aged 9 to 26 years. This lady is very active in the "banc villageois".

She holds a stand of vegetables and condiments at the town market. She purchases vegetables at the southern regional market for retail sales,  by lot or in measured quantities, depending on the customer's needs.

With her new loan, she will buy onions and potatoes - at least two 20-kg bags of each product - and various seasonings..

With the profits, she intends to actively participate in managing family responsibilities and also increase her savings.

loans.use: buy onions and potatoes - at least two 20-kg bags of each product - and various seasonings.

loans.name: Astou's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe de 22 membres fait partie du banc villageois qui a été créé le 24 octobre 2012. Il est composé des membres qui vivent dans la même localité et dans les villages environnants. Les membres entretiennent de très bonnes relations et sont solidaire. La plupart s'investit dans le commerce.
Marème, debout à droite de la photo et levant la main est âgée de 28 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de 02 enfants dont 01 garçon. Elle s'investit dans le commerce de denrées alimentaires. Elle achète 30 Kg d'arachide à 400 F le Kg qu'elle revend à 500 F le Kg, 100 Kg de mil à 200 F le Kg revendu à 250 F le Kg, 50 Kg de niébé à 400 F revendu à 500 F le Kg. En parallèle elle confectionne des nappes et torchons qu'elle envie vendre à la capitale à 3000 F la pièce.
Les bénéfices lui permettent de renforcer son épargne. Elle aide son mari dans la gestion du foyer et subvient à ses propres besoins. Mais la majeur partie de ses bénéfices servent à renforcer son épargne.
texts.en:
This group of 22 people makes up a part of the banc villageois established on 24 October 2012. It is made up of members who live in the same area and surrounding villages. They get along and support each other. Most of the group engages in commerce.

Marème, standing on the right in the photo with her hand raised, is 28 years old. She is married and a mother of two children, one of whom is a boy. 

Marème selle foodstuffs. [With her loan] she is going to buy 30 kilograms of groundnuts at 400 francs a kilogram, which she will resell at 500 francs a kilogram; 100 kilograms of millet at 200 francs a kilogram, which she will resell at 250 francs a kilogram; 50 kilograms of black-eyed peas at 400 francs a kilogram, which she will resell at 500 francs a kilogram. Additionally, she makes tablecloths and tea towels that she would like to sell at 3,000 francs each.

Marème helps her husband with the household expenses and her own needs. But a major part of her earnings will be used to increase her savings.

loans.use: to buy millet, black-eyed peas, and groundnuts

loans.name: Benita

texts.en:
Benita owns and manages a retail store selling a variety of fruits in the market for a living. She has been doing this for many years, earning well for the family, and she was able to repay her previous loan successfully. 

Recently, she borrowed a new loan to purchase more fruits to resell in order to gain more income. She plans to expand her business and use her generated income to repair her house in order to create better living conditions for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more fruits to resell.

loans.name: Ma. Grezil

texts.en: Ma. Grezil has been operating a general store selling grocery goods in the local community for years earning well for the family. She used her previous loan from GDMPC to add to her inventory capital and she successfully repaid it. Recently, she borrowed a new loan from GDMPC to buy more grocery goods to resell in order to boost her grocery store. She is hopeful she will gain more profit to save more for the future of her entire family.

loans.use: to buy more grocery goods to resell.

loans.name: Jim

texts.en: Jim is operating a business providing transportation services to local community members to earn a living. He has been doing this for eleven years earning well for the family. He was able to repay his previous loan successfully where he used it in repairing his vehicle. To improve his services, Jim borrowed a new loan recently from GDMPC to buy new tires in order to improve his services. Jim is hopeful that he will gain more returns and use them for their living.

loans.use: to buy new tires.

loans.name: Jeneveb

texts.en: Jeneveb vends dried fish in the market for a living. She has been doing this for more than nine years earning well for the family. She was able to repay her previous loan from GDMPC successfully. She used her previous loan to improve her business. Recently, she borrowed a new loan to purchase more dried fish to resell. She is hopeful that she will gain more profit from her business. Jeneveb wants to improve the general living situation of her entire family in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more dried fish to resell.

location.town: Sto. Niño, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a general store business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for three years.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her general store business. She is borrowing PHP 22,000 through NWTF to buy more items to sell in her general store.

Gina has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She hopes to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Dana Cefy

texts.es:
Dana se ha caracterizado por ser una mujer pujante y activa, una madre y esposa ejemplar. Durante su vida productiva se ha dedicado a realizar capacitaciones sobre belleza y actualmente está generando recursos económicos como estilista independiente, pues tiene su propia sala de belleza en la que trabaja sola todos los días; así logra aportar a la economía del hogar y además paga sus estudios de actualización que realiza permanentemente.
El dinero del crédito que solicita, será invertido en la compra de insumos al por mayor (tratamientos capilares, tinturas, shampoo y acondicionador, entre otros)  para terminar de cancelar sus cursos de actualización en temas de belleza; esto le permitirá tener disponibilidad de inventario para prestar un servicio más ágil y con productos de excelente calidad, además podrá estar a la vanguardia con respecto a los nuevos looks que se utilizan para ofrecer versatilidad y nuevos estilos a sus clientes; lo que será un factor diferenciador.
Dana tiene como propósito a corto plazo, la acreditación y fortalecimiento de su negocio, para que le permita generar una estabilidad económica que le ayude a solventar los gastos básicos del hogar y así mejorar la calidad de vida de los que ama.
texts.en:
Dana is characterized as an active and energetic woman, an exemplary mother and wife. During her working life, she has made a living doing beauty trainings, and she is currently generating an income as an independent stylist. She has her own beauty salon where she works every day. In this way, she is able to contribute to the budget of her home and pay for the refresher courses that she continuously participates in.

The money from the loan she is requesting will be invested in the purchase of wholesale supplies (hair treatments, hair dyes, shampoo, conditioner, and more) in order to finish paying off her refresher course on beauty topics. This will allow her to have the inventory available to offer more flexible services and excellent quality products. She will also be able to be at the cutting edge with respect to the new looks that are being used, so she can offer versatility and new styles to her customers, which will be a differentiating factor.

Dana has the short-term aim of accrediting and strengthening her business, which will allow her to generate economic stability, which in turn will help her to cover basic home expenses and thus improve the quality of life of those that she loves.

loans.use: To buy wholesale supplies (hair treatments, hair dye, shampoo, conditioner, and more) in order to finish paying for her refresher courses on beauty topics

loans.name: Venera

texts.ru: Венере 50 лет, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитывают 1 сына. У Венеры - высшее образование, она работает в местной школе преподавателем кыргызского языка, в качестве дополнительного дохода для своей семьи Венера занимается животноводством, стартовав 7 лет назад, с покупки скота на 8,000 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Венеры, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 1 дойная корова с теленком, 4 овцы и 10 коз. Ежемесячный доход составляет 19,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Венера обратилась в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом - на покупку ягнят для увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита Венера планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, и планирует накопить средства на дальнейшее обучение сына.
texts.en: Venera is 50 years old and she is married with one son.  She has a high school education and she works as a Kyrgyz language teacher at the local school.  As an additional source of income for her family, Venera raises livestock.  She started this business seven years ago with the purchase of livestock for 8,000 som KGS.  Thanks to her hard work, her farm now has one dairy cow with a calf, four sheep and ten goats.  Her monthly income is 19,000 som (KGS).  With the goal of developing her business further, Venera has turned to the microfinance bank "Bai-Tushum and Partners" for a loan to by lambs to increase her head of livestock.  She plans to use the income from this to further increase her head of livestock and to save up money for her son's education.

loans.use: to buy lambs

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Marilyn works hard to support her family.

She has a videoke machine rental business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store.  Marilyn is borrowing PHP 8,000 through NWTF to purchase spare parts and tools for the maintenance of her videoke machine.

Marilyn has been sustaining her business activities through her past four loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts and tools for the maintenance of her videoke machine

loans.name: Kiran Shehzadi

texts.en:
Kiran Shehzadi is a 34-year-old housewife. She lives with her husband, a daughter, and a son in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. 

Since 2007, her husband has had a general store, and he works very hard to meet his family's needs. He needs additional capital for the growth of his business. His wife, Kiran Shehzadi, has requested a loan from Kiva partner BRAC Pakistan. 

With the loan money, her husband can buy a variety of goods for his general store to satisfy his clients more professionally as well as to increase his savings for the better future of his children.

Kiran Shehzadi and her husband are very hopeful that the loan will be a lucky and productive one for their family.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of goods for her general store.

loans.name: Rogers

texts.en:
Rogers is 31 years old and is married with two children. He earns his income through the sale of crops and through livestock. He earns a monthly wage as a Community Knowledge Worker (CKW). Community Knowledge Workers are trusted community members who provide agricultural data and advice to rural farmers in their local area, including information about the weather, market prices, crop diseases and agricultural tools. 

On his land Rogers grows coffee, maize, beans, cassava, sweet potatoes and bananas. He also has cows, goats, and chickens. 

As a CKW, Rogers will use the materials in his business-in-a-box (a smartphone, a solar charging set, and a weighing scale) to disseminate vital agricultural information to the other members of his village, helping them adopt better farming practices to improve crop yields and increase their incomes. With the additional money he will earn as a CKW, Rogers will expand his coffee garden and increase his coffee production. His biggest dream in life is to be the largest coffee producer in his community

loans.use: to purchase a mobile phone, solar charging set and a weighing scale.

loans.name: Lela

texts.en:
Lela, age 48, is from the village of Lisi. She lives with her husband, daughter, son, daughter-in-law, two grandchildren and retired mother-in-law. Lela’s husband has chronic health problems and gets small-sized assistance from the local government. Her daughter is employed at the local kindergarten as a nurse and her son is a security guard.
 
In order to generate a stable monthly income on her own, Lela decided to start a grocery store in her village and sell various food products. She has already rented a store and now requests a loan to buy construction materials for renovation. She will also buy merchandise such as meat and dairy products, oil, pasta, rice and other products. Lela will work as a salesperson and serve her clients in a friendly way. The family will earn a monthly income and they will be able to cover household expenses as well as improve their living conditions in the future.

loans.use: to start up a grocery store.

loans.name: Antonina

texts.en:
Antonina, who is a 30-year-old divorced woman, lives in Gardabani district. She has an 18-year-old student daughter and a mother, who works as a cleaner and earns 300 GEL each month. Antonina married at an early age and wasn’t able to get an education so she has no university degree. 

Antonia has just started a trading business. Antonina goes to Turkey and purchases the products at wholesale prices and then resells them among her friends and villagers. She established her current business and is working hard on developing it to meet her customers' needs and requests. For this reason, she is obtaining a loan from Kiva partner Credo, to increase her business merchandise. She hopes that in the future she'll be capable of opening a clothing store. Antonina is very thankful to all Kiva lenders for their help.

loans.use: to have money for working capital.

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James is 27 years old and is married with one child. He earns his income through the sale of crops and livestock. 

He earns a monthly wage as a Community Knowledge Worker (CKW). Community Knowledge Workers are trusted community members who provide agricultural data and advice to rural farmers in their local area, including information about the weather, market prices, crop diseases and agricultural tools.

On his land James grows maize, beans, coffee, cassava, cabbages and bananas. He also has cows, goats and chickens.

As a CKW, James will use the materials in his business-in-a-box (a smartphone, a solar charging set, and a weighing scale) to disseminate vital agricultural information to the other members of his village, helping them to improve their crop yields and increase their incomes. With the additional money he will earn as a CKW, James will invest in livestock, particularly poultry and a start up a retail business in his village. His biggest dream in life is to be a large-scale producer of agricultural products.

loans.use: To purchase a mobile phone, a solar charging set and a weighing scale
